新醒来的战士们利用他们的第一个回合拿起武器并发动攻击。两名战士推倒了冒险者身旁的双层床。在它的路径上的人必须进行一次{@dc 13} 敏捷豁免检定，否则会被击倒{@condition prone}。或者，角色可以进行一次{@dc 13} 力量豁免检定，试图用力量阻止双层床的倾倒。

entries.name: 25. Memorial Hall

entries: 墙壁上雕刻着只能是名字——使这个房间成为一个纪念堂。题字沿着唯一的门道两侧排列。
门北侧的铭文写着"乌恩 达拉 玛纳凯 (Uhn dara ma'nakai)，"意为"我们的责任永不终止。"另一横梁上写着"乌恩 奥瑞基 阿图姆 (Uhn ore'ki atum)，"意为"我们的思想合而为一。"

entries.name: 26. Kitchen
entries: 这些githyanki可能是勇士，但厨房里不可能有他们的武器或盔甲。他们的护甲等级为12，使用厨房刀和擀面杖等临时武器战斗，造成相应类型的{@damage 1d4}伤害。如果他们发现入侵者，{@creature Githyanki Warrior|MM|githyanki warriors}会通过{@spell misty step}法术前往27区通知其他人。

entries.name: 29A. Empty Cell
entries:
请在监狱牢房里使用以下任何一种涂鸦：
1. "自由是我的梦想 (%num%)" (Freedom is my dream)
2. "坚强不屈 (%num%)" (Strength and resilience)
3. "希望在远方 (%num%)" (Hope is on the horizon)

items: 在{@language Common|PHB}，"想要玩得愉快，就传送到4182 Ghanishtalil。"接着是一个传送序列。如果被传送到，冒险者们会发现自己身处于火元素位面的铜城市的一处公寓废墟中。
在{@language Dwarvish|PHB}，"你妈妈是只仓鼠，你懂吗？"
在{@language Common|PHB}，"记住：在其他行星上舔门把手是违法的。" 旁边是一个带有X形眼睛的皱眉脸。
在{@language Orc|PHB|Orcish}，"Bork来过这里。Bork并不喜欢这里的时间。Bork必须给它评2/5星。"
在{@language Deep Speech|PHB}，"末日将至！"
在{@language Draconic|PHB}，"我们在岩石和岩石上建造了这座城市。"
在一种只能通过魔法理解的奇怪语言中，"我是LRRR，OMICRON PERSEI 8星球的统治者！你们脆弱的岩石将会崩溃！"
六千个记号，每个可能代表一天。

entries: 独自冥想的另一位吉思(Gith)感觉...与众不同。他身上没有悬挂着战斗仇恨的阴云，而是一片宁静。他橄榄色的皮肤被深紫色的伤痕覆盖，一只眼罩几乎遮住了他脸上一道古老的伤疤。

entries.name: 29D. Guard Room
entries: 这里的战法师们并没有料到会有闯入者，他们认为任何干扰都是来自{@creature Al'chaia|WDMM}或者她的折磨者之一的意外访问。他们漠不关心地调查着一个被打开的牢房。

entries.name: Tactics
entries: 这场短暂的战斗遵循以下战术：

items: gish不会在监狱牢房（区域29A-C）内战斗，因为每个房间都充满了反魔法区域。他们会撤退到区域29D或其他地方进行战斗。
在战斗的第一个回合中，阿鲁特{@spell fireball|PHB|fireballs}攻击了队伍，而杨戈尔施放了{@spell haste}在自己身上。
经过一轮战斗后，(githyanki)通过南门逃往30区。他们的意图很容易被推测出来，角色可以移动去拦截。如果他们的撤退被切断，他们会改道去29A区。

entries.name: 33. Graduation Chamber
entries: 如果冒险者实力过强，但没有被立即杀死，那么{@creature Al'chaia|WDMM}或{@creature Ashtyrranthor|WDMM}会把他们带到这里来处决。每个囚犯都会被{@item manacles|PHB}（15点生命值，逃脱需要{@dc 20}敏捷检定，强行破解需要{@dc 20}力量检定，成功使用{@item thieves' tools|PHB}进行拾取需要{@dc 15}敏捷检定）所束缚。

entries.name: Epilogue
entries: 穿过水晶迷宫后，队伍应该升级到15级的一半。
用下面的告别语结束本次游戏。每个告别语都假设队伍通过传送门进入和离开了星码堡，你将在下一章的WDMM中运行下面描述的矩阵事件。这两个事件都致力于传播哈拉斯特的谎言，让队伍相信他们实际上在水深之地。

entries.name: The matrix
entries: 当冒险者们通过传送门返回托瑞尔时，他们似乎到达了沃特德普，但实际上现在被{@creature ulitharid|VGM}的L17级的Extremiton所控制。哈拉斯特用{@spell wish}法术策划了他们的被捕，将角色传送到区域14和15的心灵荚中，立即使他们进入沉睡并陷入奥特迪普。哈拉斯特用{@spell modify memory}的法术抹去了任何关于这些事件的回忆。
在你身后，吉萨奴基(githyanki)尖锐而刺耳的呼喊声响彻耳畔，你们投入了一场狂热的冲刺！传送门就在前方隐现，你手中的法杖开始发光！你将其猛力插入底座，打开了通往托瑞尔(Toril)的传送门。吉萨奴基投射出刀剑般的灵能匕首，砸向石墙，他们紧追不舍，愤怒化为精神力量。你冲向传送门——最后你听到的是一条龙在黑暗虚空中咆哮着它的愤怒。
当你出现时，世界突然倾斜了九十度，你被从一个旧井中向上抛出，就像被呕吐出来一样。你四处张望，发现自己身处熟悉的(Yawning Portal)酒吧。顾客们惊奇地凝视着你。

entries.name: The Host's Send-Off
entries: 将以下内容添加到上述标准出发语中：
当人群面无表情地凝视着你，火鸡腿上滴着油脂，酒杯未喝完，哈拉斯特的声音悄悄地进入你的脑海。这一次，他听起来有些尴尬："嗯，星际旅行是一件棘手的事情，你看，确实是一件棘手的事情。这让我的整个系统都崩溃了。我很快就会回来找你们，我的参赛者！在我回来之前，尽量不要太过享受辉煌之城！"
你可以选择喝下蓝色药剂，忘记一切... 或者你可以选择喝下红色药剂，推翻这位心灵暴君，

items: 这一章节假设你正在进行前一章节中包含的任务：哈拉斯特在派对从星码回来时让他们入睡，并将他们交给了埃克斯特里顿的控制。因此，他们从Alterdeep内部开始这一层的探索，他们的进度是倒置的，因为他们必须在从模拟中脱身后逃离{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers'}的围墙。
Extremiton喜欢扮演{@creature Durnan|WDH}，《酣畅之口》酒馆的老板和所有者。
如果Extremiton（晶体王座）离开他的晶体王座，Alterdeep（变革深渊）模拟将立即结束。然而，受试者仍然被psipods（灵能莲蓬）的灵能渲染为{@condition unconscious}。
地下河旁边的生物是{@condition deafened}; 掉进去的生物必须进行一次{@dc 15}(Strength)豁免检定，否则会被冲走60英尺（成功则为30英尺）。
{@creature flumph|MM|Flumphs}是有心灵感应能力、聪明智慧的知识收集者，而不仅仅是随机的心灵水母！
这一层的吉萨因基(Githyanki)是从克雷什·克利尔(Créche K'liir)部署而来的，他们说着{@language Draconic|PHB}。

entries.name: Previously on Dungeon of the Mad Mage
entries: 请记住以下事项：

items: {@creature Durnan|WDH}可能已经让冒险者们找出一直在与水深市民进行心灵感应联系的生物。请参阅《揭开水深市心灵感应{@creature Spy|MM}》。
冒险者们可能已经在L16，A6B上通过水晶球看到了Extremiton。
可能已经有足够的时间让(吉萨因奇)向他们在L17的部队传达有关派对的消息。如果(厄隆)发送了这条消息，这里的敌人可能会变成中立。

entries.name: Extremiton's Game
entries: 在其水晶王座上，埃克斯特里顿（Extremiton）沉浸在奥特迪普（Alterdeep）中，这是它最伟大幻想的结晶。多亏了哈拉斯特（Halaster）的{@spell wish}，一些值得的测试对象已被送入模拟中。因此，冒险者们在奥特迪普中已经开始了L17的旅程。

entries.name: Halaster's Game
entries: 如果你正在运行{@i Companion's}游戏节目元素，这只是《疯狂法师之迷宫》的又一集——现在整个多元宇宙都能看到并欣赏到艾克斯特里米顿的天才，{@creature ulitharid|VGM|ulitharid's}脆弱的自尊心已经膨胀到难以想象的程度。
Extremiton已经被警告，它不能永远留住派对，只能是两周。当冒险者们找到了解脱的方法时，哈拉斯特(Halaster)不会伸出手把他们放回去——尽管Extremiton不禁试图留住它所得到的一切。

entries.name: Vignettes
entries: 在运行《深渊变动》时是一项挑战；你不仅需要欺骗玩家，同时也要暗示他们处于模拟中，还必须运行一个"城镇"剧集。Extremiton对冒险者没有真正的最终目标，除了尽可能长时间地让他们留在模拟中，没有宏伟的情节。因此，以小插曲的形式来运行这个模拟：让队伍穿越沃特德普，解决情节线，处理个人事务，并逛商店。在这个轻松的场景中，播种一些小插曲（见下文），可以暗示真相。

entries.name: Dragon Heist
entries: 如果你的团队也进行过{@adventure Waterdeep: Dragon Heist|WDH}活动，你可以加入一些与该活动中角色有关系的角色。尽管Extremiton已经了解了一些细节，但它可能无法完全准确地呈现，而团队熟悉的人物总会显得有些不同。

entries.name: Other Subjects
entries: 正如第14区所描述的那样，有另外九名受害者被卷入了Extremiton的游戏。你只需要关注其中的一小部分。以下是一些受害者的详细信息。队伍应该会遇到其中一些角色，他们意识到瓦特德普发生了一些不对劲的事情。

entries.name: Roleplaying Extremiton
entries: Extremiton（艾克斯特雷米顿）对凡人非常着迷。当然，它们只是被当作食物的牲口，但它们不是很可爱吗？它们不是很滑稽吗？虽然它的Alterdeep（奥特迪普）模拟有助于让水深之都的人民为奴役做好准备，但真正的目的是，Extremiton（艾克斯特雷米顿）只是想和普通人类和精灵一起玩耍，亲自了解他们的思维方式和工作方式，理解他们的伤感情绪。Alterdeep（奥特迪普）是它实现自己从蝌蚪时代起就一直梦想的地方。

entries.name: Goals
entries: Extremiton（艾克斯特里米顿）的首要目标，除了自身和殖民地的生存之外，是Alterdeep（奥特深渊）实验。无论其新的测试对象有多么吸引人，实验始终排在第一位，即使以牺牲他们的生命和理智为代价。知道它们比通常的牲畜更坚韧，Extremiton（艾克斯特里米顿）将它们用作更多疯狂实验的试验品。它还很好奇测试一次恶心的侵略，看看像他们这样的强大冒险者在混乱中会如何行动：他们会逃跑、逃走，如何最好地对付{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers'}及其奴隶等等。

entries.name: Flaws of the Simulation
entries: Extremiton的模拟并非完美。正如《WDMM》中所描述的那样，如果遇到缺陷，{@creature ulitharid|VGM} 会尝试纠正它或转移注意力。以下列表代表了Alterdeep的几个缺陷，您可以向小队展示：

items:
Extremiton speaks {@language Common|PHB}, but not {@language Dwarvish|PHB}, {@language Elvish|PHB}, or {@language Infernal|PHB}. The party find few dwarves, elves, or tieflings in the city. Any character they know that frequently speaks to them in one of these languages instead speaks exclusively in {@language Common|PHB}—which should come as a surprise. 

艾克斯特里米顿（Extremiton）会说{@language Common|PHB}，但不会说{@language Dwarvish|PHB}，{@language Elvish|PHB}，或{@language Infernal|PHB}。在这座城市里，派对发现很少有矮人、精灵或提弗林（dwarves, elves, or tieflings）。任何他们认识的角色，经常用这些语言与他们交谈，现在却只说{@language Common|PHB}—这应该会让他们感到惊讶。
错误——"臂端"称之为"臂虫"，尽管其同类鲎人不知其所以然——有时会在模拟角色中出现。这些出现错误的个体可能会重复相同的台词，走进墙壁或其他障碍物，或者出现痴呆状态。如果你想要营造滑稽的氛围，当这些错误发生时，实际上会出现昆虫（例如，故障的模拟角色会被附近的甲虫吸引）。

每隔一段时间，区域8中的{@creature neothelid|VGM}会足够愤怒地反抗其监禁，从而在洞穴中引发震动，使悬挂在地下河上方的钟乳石松动。当它们掉落时，会砸向发电机的墙壁，减慢水流。这可能导致短暂的停电，直到邪恶食脑者通过精神力量摧毁或移除障碍物。在停电期间，奥特深渐渐减缓；天空变暗，超出任何主体直接注意范围的细节会冻结（例如，鸟儿在半空中冻结，直到有主体看向它们）。这种停电不会唤醒任何主体。紧张的艾克斯特里米顿会跟进主体，扮演各种角色，用诸如"这些天天气疯狂啊！"或"辉煌之城，嗯？更像是不便之城！"或"魔法，对吧？"等短语来淡化事件。

entries.name: Hints & Tidbits
entries: 在进行《深域变动》时，你需要透露一些微妙的线索，暗示事情并非表面看起来那样。然而，详细说明会破坏整个诡计。相反，可以在叙述中插入一些不起眼的台词：

items: 如果战役设定在寒冷的月份，"最近天气变暖了。"。同样，如果当前季节是夏天，替换为"凉爽"。
当队伍在街上行进或前往商店时，"你走过一条熟悉的街道，但当你转弯时，你注意到你喜欢的那家小面包店已经关闭，取而代之的是一家皮匠店。"
"今天风很奇怪：你可以听到它穿过街道吹过，直接掠过你，但你却感觉不到它触及你的皮肤，也不会吹动任何旗帜、国旗或帐篷帘。"
如果队伍与一个看起来有问题的熟悉角色互动后引起了怀疑，艾克斯特雷米顿会惊慌失措，并试图把那个角色描绘成一个{@creature doppelganger|MM}，而不是冒着整个模拟被揭穿的风险。不幸的是，在第二个"{@creature doppelganger|MM}"之后，冒险者很容易看穿这个脆弱的伪装。

entries.name: Inside Alterdeep
entries: 冒险者们从打开地下城的同名深坑中被呕吐出来，开始在打开地下城（Yawning Portal）中启程。阅读：

当你从那座使打哈欠之门得名的沉塔中被呕吐出来时，整个世界仿佛在咆哮。你倒在地板上，震惊了所有的客人。有人手中的玻璃杯滑落，摔碎在地板上。一个在角落里运行着《(%Krakens and Coves)》的游戏主持人停下了他慷慨激昂的讲述。所有的目光都投向了你——直到{@creature Durnan|WDH}，那个熟悉的面孔，大声喊道："这只是一群冒险者从安德玛之下被吐出来而已。有什么了不起的！别大惊小怪！"
随着这句话，酒馆恢复了繁忙的喧嚣声。疯狂法师的声音在你们的脑海中低语道："享受你们在地表的时光吧。我有一些传送网络要修理。很快我会回来找你们，亲爱的参赛者们！"
Halaster的这句话是由疯狂法师亲自为Extremiton录制的，目的是帮助销售一个谎言，即队伍已经回到了Waterdeep。

entries.name: What's Next?
entries: Alterdeep的可能性无限; 给予队伍尽情消磨时间，交际，尽情放肆。当Extremiton扮演{@creature Durnan|WDH}时，冒险者可以与其他角色玩牌或更新他们过去的任务委托者。如果队伍寻找Undermountain的新任务，他们会发现所有他们通常的线索只是在Waterdeep周围追逐的谣言，而不是地下城。

entries.name: Law and Order
entries: 提醒队伍，辉煌之城是一个以法律为准绳的城市，而不是人。即使是如此强大的冒险者也应遵守法律——在瓦特德普，自卫不是在法庭上对暴力或谋杀的有效辩护。至于艾克斯特里米顿，它并不在乎队伍是否逃脱法律的长臂，但仍会派遣城市守卫追捕他们。这些力量包括{@creature veteran|MM|veterans}，甚至{@creature mage|MM|mages}如果需要的话，都是由模拟程序创建的。如果你曾想让你的队伍成为通缉犯，但又不必担心后续的法律问题，那么现在就是机会了。

entries.name: Vignettes
entries: 离开了(Yawning Portal)后，询问队伍他们在地面上找到了一些"空闲时间"后想做些什么。让他们主导叙事，同时你可以通过小插曲来引导场景，直到他们意识到有什么不对劲，或者直到你准备将他们带出(Alterdeep)。以下是两个示例小插曲：

entries.name: Mugged
entries: 在街头行走时，一名名叫希拉斯·马克（Silas Mark）的NE {@creature bandit|MM} 抢劫了一名冒险者。"把你的钱给我，混蛋，"他要求，拔出一把刀。在他受到严厉的殴打后，希拉斯迅速说道："把你的宽恕给我，混蛋。"
如果加入了城市守卫，一名官员会奖励该队伍10 gp，以捕获"码头区恶棍-抢劫犯"（Dock Ward Punk-Mugger）。

entries.name: "That Filthy Tongue"
entries: 队伍遇到了两个矮人居民，贾拉娜·锤石（Jarana Hammer-stone）和道达拉克·钢拳（Daundarak Steelfist）。矮人们感到困惑：他们的同胞突然不再说{@language Dwarvish|PHB}（一个Extremiton不懂的语言）。无论如何，他们的伙伴们只会用{@language Common|PHB}回应。他们说，这对于一个老朋友梅尔卡里（Melkari）来说尤其奇怪，因为他很久以前发誓再也不说"那种肮脏的语言"了。
当派对寻找梅尔卡瑞时，埃克斯特里米顿开始担心，将他扭曲成一个{@creature doppelganger|MM}来解释他奇怪的行为——尽管这并不能解释其他矮人为什么还在说{@language Common|PHB}。埃克斯特里米顿后来将贾拉娜和道纳拉克完全从模拟中移除。

entries.name: Escaping Alterdeep
entries: 如何让派对逃离奥特迪普（Alterdeep）取决于你：默认情况下，只有埃克斯特里米顿（Extremiton）或外部干预才能结束模拟。从以下方法中选择，或按照以下情节进行：

items: 一旦角色确信自己处于模拟之中，他们可以尝试进行一次{@dc 23}智力检定，试图在心灵上摆脱枷锁，从psipod中醒来。
第7区域的(吉萨因奇)可能会对基地发动袭击，从而解救队伍脱离他们的灵能囚笼。

entries.name: 1. The Blue Potion or the Red Potion
entries: 当你已经玩够了Alterdeep，你可以运行这个故事线来将冒险者从模拟中移除。

一群吉斯赛人，可能由15级的Yrlakka领导，远程渗透模拟环境以释放被囚禁者并结束Extremiton的游戏。通过精心操纵他们自己的思维，这四名{@creature githzerai zerth|MM|githzerai zerths}可以在Alterdeep中潜行而不被察觉。他们寻找冒险者，变换各种伪装以躲避Extremiton的审查，后者无法察觉到他们，并最初将他们视为系统中的错误。冒险者们可能会产生怀疑，因为吉斯赛人多次与队伍相遇，但又中止了他们的计划，因为他们能感觉到Extremiton将注意力从模拟环境中的其他主体转回他们身上。因此，队伍可能会注意到这些奇怪的角色。
当冒险者们最终联系到时，吉斯赛人通过向艾克斯特里米顿超载精神反馈，成功让模拟系统短暂失灵，使其失明。他们知道{@creature ulitharid|VGM}很快会让系统恢复运行，于是他们脱去伪装，坦率地谈论关于奥深改变和如何解救该队伍。请阅读以下内容：
一名精灵张开嘴巴，但停顿了一下，抬头看向天空：乌云滚滚覆盖了水深渊市。你周围的人放慢了脚步，将注意力集中在天际线上。
吞咽着，精灵用手掌掩面——他那尖锐的、精灵般的面容消失了，取而代之的是一张吉斯人的橄榄色皮肤。"冒险者们，我们必须赶紧交谈，在艾克斯特里米顿修好机器并发现我们的叛乱之前。"
这位{@creature githzerai zerth|MM}是伊尔拉卡(Yrlakka)，如果他还活着的话。他目睹了冒险者们被捕获(psionically remotely or in person if he accompanied them to L16)。他和他的{@creature githzerai zerth|MM|zerths}相信这是他们的责任来结束这个邪恶的游戏。
在进行了简短的反驳后，伊尔拉卡开始了一段直接摘自《黑客帝国》的独白。请阅读以下内容：
吉思（Gith）吞咽着；汗珠从他的额头上滑落。"奥特深渊（Alterdeep）就在我们周围。这个世界就像是你眼前的羊毛，是一个你被迫进入的监狱，一个你看不见、闻不到、摸不到的监狱——一个针对你思想的牢笼。"
gith 从它的袍子里拿出两瓶药剂，一瓶红色，一瓶蓝色。"唉，你不能简单地被告知 Alterdeep 就能逃脱它；你必须亲眼见到。做出你的选择：你选择蓝色药剂，就会忘记这一切。你可以留在 Alterdeep 这里过你们的生活，享受你们应得的休息，直到那一天，那头邪恶的智利德厌倦了或被它的敌人击倒。
"或者，你可以选择服用红色药剂，我们将一起推翻这位心灵暴君，解放所有被困在其邪恶游戏中的人。选择权在你手中；我们不会评判。你已经赢得了喘息的机会—但从现在开始就无法回头了。{@creature mind flayer|MM} 很快会修好它的机器，届时我们将只是你心灵中的一道阴影。"
如果队伍选择喝下蓝色药水，{@creature githzerai zerth|MM|zerths}将退出Alterdeep，暂时将队伍置于命运之中。队伍可以在自己的时间里找到其他逃离模拟的方法，但他们对这次遭遇的记忆将被抹去。
如果冒险者从红色药水中喝一口，他们就能看到Alterdeep是多么虚伪。请阅读以下内容：
你喝下了一口红色药水——片刻间，什么也没有发生。这是个把戏吗？骗局？一个骗子操纵的诈骗？疯狂法师本人会不会突然出现，大喊："抓住你！"？
然后它打击了你——世界向左移动了三英尺，你可以看到它是多么荒谬。一切都笼罩在一片薄雾中，一种半透明的薄雾。除了那些gith和你的同伴；他们是唯一坚实的。他们是唯一真实的。世界周围有缝隙，一串串你无法理解、也永远不应该理解的外星文字。
羊毛已经从你的眼睛中揭开；这个"深渊变革"(`Alterdeep`)已经被背叛，现在你又可以自由地决定自己的道路了。
在喝下红色药剂后，伊尔拉卡解释了模拟的本质和机制。他特别提到，它的主人喜欢伪装成{@creature Durnan|WDH}，很可能现在就在打哈欠门口，观察其他模拟对象。他建议他们直接去那里打斗，以免埃克斯特里米顿发现被制造出来并挫败了他们的计划。

不幸的是，冒险者们的新意识在奥尔特迪普传播开来，引起了艾克斯特里米顿的怀疑。在接下来的10分钟内，艾克斯特里米顿从消除{@creature githzerai zerth|MM|zerths'}心灵反馈中返回。每小时，每位冒险者必须进行{@dc 15}智力({@skill Stealth})检定来愚弄艾克斯特里米顿。吉思族角色在这次检定中获得优势。如果有一名角色失败，艾克斯特里米顿会察觉到他们的意识，并在奥尔特迪普各处布置怪物。

entries.name: True vs. True
entries: 一旦派对成员喝下红色药剂，他们将不再受模拟的伤害。只有像(Extremiton)和其他被连接在灵能容器中的生物，才能伤害已经苏醒的角色。

entries.name: 2. The Battle of the Yawning Portal
entries: 拥有真相的冒险者们可以骑马前往打败深渊巨人在打呵欠传送门。如果他们成功击败{@creature ulitharid|VGM}，模拟器就会出现故障并短路；仍在模拟器中的所有生物必须进行{@dc 18}智力豁免检定，否则会受到36({@damage 8d8})点精神伤害。成功豁免的生物只受到一半伤害。

entries.name: Reinforcements
entries: 如果Extremiton得知主体们知道Alterdeep的真相，它会命令它的同胞将手下放入模拟中（因为虚假生物不再能伤害它们）：最多六个{@creature orog|MM|orogs}，四个{@creature troglodyte|MM|troglodytes}，两个{@creature duergar|MM}，和两个{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}。这些手下绝对服从Extremiton的命令。它们会加入到Yawning Portal；Extremiton改变他们的外貌，使他们看起来像普通的顾客。角色可以使用一个动作，在成功的{@dc 15}智力检定后，辨别出这个幻象。

entries.name: 3. Aftermath
entries: 如果在奥尔特迪普（Alterdeep）中杀死了Extremiton，那么它也会在现实中被消灭，立即结束模拟。冒险者和其他任何受试者会在他们故障的灵能舱中苏醒（参见区域14和15）。随着Extremiton的消失，蛇头也随之而去，让{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}陷入混乱。按照正常方式运行该级别，但路径进展被倒置，因为队伍将从内部开始而不是从外部开始。

entries.name: The Neolithid
entries: 随着厄里斯德人陷入混乱，很可能 {@creature neothelid|VGM} (见区域8) 被释放。被其他智力生物的气味驱使，它袭击了吉萨因凯要塞 (区域7)，冲破了 {@language Qualith|VGM} 锁着的门，挤过走廊。同样可能会通过A16A攻击 {@creature mind flayer|MM} 复合体。冒险者们肯定会与它相遇，或者至少听到它在西德普斯造成的残酷破坏。

entries.name: Areas of Note
entries: 以下区域值得注意：

entries.name: 1. Tunnel Plexus

entries: 你来到了一个洞穴的交汇点，这些隧道就像老人体内的静脉曲张一样蜿蜒穿行在潮湿的土壤中。
当冒险队探索隧道时，他们遇到了{@creature flumph|MM}具尸体。请阅读以下内容：
在你潮湿的徒步旅行中，你遇到了一种非常奇怪的生物：一只巨大的类似水母的生物，它的眼柄闭合着，触须被切断了。
进行一次{@dc 14}智力检定({@skill Arcana})，可以识别这个生物为{@creature flumph|MM}；虽然它们罕见且局限于地下世界，但它们奇特的存在被广泛认知，就像针鼹鼠在我们的世界中一样。

entries.name: 3. Halaster's Maw
entries: 作为对立即造成伤害的替代方案，你可以让陷阱慢慢施加压力，给受害者一个反应的机会。为陷阱投掷先攻，其先攻值为{@skillCheck initiative 3}。在它的回合，它会捕捉，对未能通过其{@dc 17}敏捷豁免检定的生物造成88点打击伤害({@damage 16d10})，对通过检定的生物造成一半伤害。
如果你选择给角色一个机会，阅读：
陷阱——你应该知道的！当你扰动碎石时，墙壁开始活动并开始向内挤压！你可以听到力量在那些活动的墙壁后面积聚！转眼间，它们就要关闭，将你压成一团血肉！

entries.name: 4. Flumph Cloister

entries: 洞穴里弥漫着一股柔和、温暖的能量，它像一团薄雾般包裹着你的思绪。一股声音从你的脑海中传来，就像它是属于那里一样，就像它一直在那里一样——但这不是那个阴险的疯狂法师，哦不。这股声音带着一种关切的语气：
"嘿！听着！恶心虫潜伏在附近，吉斯扬奇也在附近。你应该逃离这个地方！"
如果冒险者没有展示威胁行为，{@creature flumph|MM|flumphs} 会一个接一个地从天花板上降下来，亲自向队伍打招呼。

entries.name: Roleplaying Flumphs
entries: {@creature flumph|MM|Flumphs} 是睿智和仁慈的生物，它们的情绪会反映在它们发出的柔和颜色中。这里的{@creature flumph|MM|flumphs} 因为担心而生病，所以发出一种灰蓝色的光。它们会很高兴遇到与邪恶邻居形成鲜明对比的善良的人。
{@creature flumph|MM|Flumphs}具有心灵感应能力，因此可以与冒险者进行完整的对话；为了与其异世界的生理形态形成对比，他们会以正常稳定的方式说话。

如果冒险小组在他们的洞穴中休息，他们可以期待哲学和历史课程，因为{@creature flumph|MM|flumphs}们对他们的客人感到兴奋。他们可以提供一个地下山的秘密（来自WDMM的附录B），并揭示当前引起你的玩家兴趣的任何神秘之事，比如Jhesiyra Kestellharp，Halaster的历史，或者其他层级上的生物，比如第18层的Vanrakdoom{@creature cultist|MM|cultists}。他们还可以感知到第22层的Shadowdusk Hold中回荡的精神能量；与远域接触或甚至被带入的畸变生物让他们感到恐惧。

entries.name: Into the Stronghold
entries: 穿过秘密门，队伍可以直接跳到深处{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers'}基地的13区。然而，如果没有办法操作{@language Qualith|VGM}门锁，他们将无法继续前进。

entries.name: 5. Githyanki Grave

entries: 天花板上渗入了一条条浑浊的水流。当你扫视洞穴时，你发现一个凹处——那里堆积着尸体，形状让人感到熟悉。
刻在壁龛上方的空间里是用异世界{@language Gith|MM}文字刻着"乌恩 达拉 玛纳凯"。它的翻译是"我们的责任永无止境。"一个被{@spell comprehend languages|PHB}咒语影响的角色得知了这个信息。

你来到了一个惨烈的场面，一个古老和最近的战斗的坟场。地面上散落着{@creature ogre|MM|ogres}、{@creature orc|MM|orcs}、{@creature duergar|MM}、{@creature Troglodyte|MM|trogs}、githyanki，以及是的，{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers} 的尸体。所有八个人都被斩首了。
七个思想君主头颅，每个都被安放在一根长矛上，面对着一扇被外星锁紧的门。它们的触手垂落无力，无疑是对它们所谓的至高无上的一种讽刺。

entries.name: 6C. One Brave Flumph
entries: 当冒险者遇到{@creature flumph|MM}时，请阅读：
刻在壁龛上方的空间中的文字是"乌恩 达拉 玛纳凯"用异世界的{@language Gith|MM}文字书写。它的翻译是"我们的责任永无止境。"一个被{@spell comprehend languages|PHB}咒语影响的角色得知了这个信息。漂浮在壁龛中的是一只奇怪的类似水母的生物，它温和的声音深深地触及你的心灵：
"幸会，我希望。"
如果冒险者与{@creature flumph|MM}展开对话，添加：
这个生物对你低声说道："我们是无害的种族，但是吉萨因卡人把我们当作害虫——像你们人类对待老鼠一样消灭{@homebrew us|it them}。我并无恶意；我们并无恶意，却仅仅因为出生的偶然而被剿灭。"
勇敢的{@creature flumph|MM}决定扮演一个守望者的角色，以防止吉萨因卡（Githyanki）离开他们的据点；每当他们离开时，它可以感知到心灵能量的变化，并会在他们离开前大约两分钟离开。然后它会警告它的同伴。吉萨因卡使用被魔法操控的被斩断的{@creature mind flayer|MM}头颅来打开锁。

entries.name: Qualith lock
entries: {@creature flumph|MM}非常愿意用它的触手为他们打开锁，尽管githyanki比illithids更少邪恶，但illithids容忍{@creature flumph|MM|flumphs'}的存在，不去剿灭他们。看到githyanki被消灭将确保{@creature flumph|MM}修道院的持续生存，即使修道院宁愿冒险去除{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}。

entries.name: Patrol
entries: 当冒险者们在这里时，两名{@creature Githyanki Warrior|MM|githyanki warriors}和一名{@creature githyanki knight|MM}巡逻队即将离开7号区域前往这个区域。{@creature flumph|MM}事先警告了冒险队，他们可以先发制人。如果巡逻队发起战斗，{@creature githyanki knight|MM|knight}会用{@language Gith|MM}大喊"Zerashk Guilda!"或"Oblivion awaits!"。其他吉斯扬奇也会回应这个战斗口号。

entries.name: 7. Githyanki Stronghold
entries: 如果冒险者们一离开星码头（见第16级）就进入了奥特迪普，那么当他们遇到吉思安基时，水晶迷宫混乱的消息应该已经传到这里的士兵那里。如果没有，那么这支队伍可能会先到达。他们在那个级别上的行动将决定吉思安基的反应：恐惧、停战或尊重。相应地进行调整。

entries.name: Roleplaying Githyanki
entries: 正如{@i Companion}第16章所描述的那样，吉萨因凯人对托瑞尔来说是外星人，因此必须相应地进行角色扮演。作为一个灵能民族，吉萨因凯人往往不会伸手去拿物品，总是依赖于一种心灵{@spell mage hand}。
你可以使用这些短语中的任何一个，这些短语取自星际争霸中虚构的卡拉尼语，以模拟{@language Gith|MM}语言：

items: "Ki nala atum!" 或者 "我们合而为一！"
"卡萨尔德圣堂武士！"或者"秩序带来正义！"
"愿你的灵魂飞翔"，常常用来支持其他战士。
"Na vazeal!" 或 "我们摧毁！"
"乌恩 达拉 玛纳凯" 或 "我们的职责是无尽的。"
"乌恩·奥瑞阿图姆" 或 "我们的思维合而为一。"
"泽拉什公会！"或者"遗忘在等待！"在吉萨亚奇社会中崇拜神明是被禁止的，因此这既是一个集结呼号，也是一个 sth dying words.

entries.name: 7A. Arch Gate to Level 15
entries: 几萨亚奇人（Githyanki）极其热衷地守护这个区域，因为如果它落入{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}的手中，他们的奴隶很容易就能绕到水晶迷宫的另一侧发动攻击。为了确保他们的敌人无法轻易做到这一点，几萨亚奇人甚至禁止在这一层保留一个六指手套。

entries.name: The Zerths
entries: {@creature githzerai zerth|MM|zerths} 潜伏在大门的另一侧。如果队伍陷入Alterdeep，而Yrlakka打算营救他们，{@creature githzerai zerth|MM|zerths} 将从这扇门进入Seadeeps，已经获得了一个六指手套。

entries.name: 7C. Knight's Quarters

entries: 在灯笼的光照下，两个人在悄声争论，他们的分歧就像一团窃窃私语的蜂鸣。

当他们发现这个派对时，{@creature githyanki knight|MM|knights} 跳起来并用心灵力量召唤他们的{@item greatsword|PHB|greatswords}。刀剑斜靠在墙上；处于剑的路径上的角色可以使用他们的反应抓住它，进行一次{@dc 14} 敏捷豁免检定。成功时，他们阻止了武器到达持有者的目标。失败时，角色受到 3 ({@damage 1d6}) 切割伤害。
与其直接投入战斗，{@creature githyanki knight|MM|knights} 会首先尝试和谈。他们会感到惊讶如果{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers'} 的奴隶们进入他们的要塞（尽管他们之前考虑过这种可能性），因此假设冒险者不是他们敌人的代理人。

entries.name: Roleplaying Yaveklar
entries: 一位老兵，亚维克拉(Yaveklar)对伤亡和损失太过熟悉，但她的心中仍然隐藏着狡诈。借鉴以下对话示例：

items: "我们是Créche K'liir的盾牌—我们不能倒下。他们也不能让我们倒下。"
"我们面临着很大的困难；没有增援，我们只能将邪恶的思想控制者（Illithids）困在他们的基地里。"
"我们不能将生命投入那个屠宰场的红喉咙。"

entries.name: Roleplaying Lashiir
entries: 热切地想要证明自己并取得进展，这位固执的拉希尔（Lashiir）迅速行动，后果不顾。请参考以下对话示例：

items: "我们是矛头，荣耀属于我们。(the tip of the spear)"
"早起的人{@creature roc|MM}有{@creature neothelid|VGM}."
"邪恶的思想食者们培育出了一个{@creature neothelid|VGM}，一个野蛮的巨兽，可以融化骨肉，但无法伤及脑部。为了世界的利益，它必须被消灭。如果我们无法直接对抗{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}，我们必须在它失控之前杀死它们的怪物。"

entries.name: 8. Operation: Eat Them All
entries: 冒险者们及时赶到，看到{@creature neothelid|VGM|neothelid's}餐被扔进了区域。房间也闪闪发光，洒下{@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|dim light}在场景上。请阅读以下内容：
当你在黑暗中悄悄前行时，你听到一扇石门砰地一声关上，一个男人的尖叫："不要！不要！带我回家！带我回家！"

好奇地，你转过弯，看到一个人在一个闪闪发光的洞穴里。水晶{@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|dim light}照亮了整个场景——但当你向前走时，你撞上了一个{@condition invisible} {@spell wall of force}。你把手放在上面，就像个哑剧演员一样，发现前方没有更多的路可走，但你仍然看着那个男人在黑暗中四处走动... 一个巨大的蠕虫从中心蜿蜒而出！它的皮肤闪闪发光，满是黏液，它竖起了没有眼睛的头！
人类转过身来，惊呆了，嘴巴大张——正好在这时，那怪物的头部像花朵一样裂开，发出一声咆哮！它的咆哮震动了整个洞穴，从它长有尖牙的嘴里伸出带刺的舌头，抓住了那个人——此刻他尖叫着，尖叫着，仿佛那样做有任何意义。
当它的受害者挣扎时，这只巨大的蠕虫呕吐出一槽酸液，将人类化为粘液——而留下的，你看到了，是它完整的大脑。小心翼翼地，这只野生生物用其中一根舌头缠绕着这个器官，然后整个吞下去。
这位受害者是伊珊·托鲁的城市守卫搭档。请参阅A10。

entries.name: 9. Guard post

entries: 聚集在这里的是{@creature orc|MM|orcs}，两行深，每行四人，都在喋喋不休，他们的盾牌交错在一起，尊严受损，心灵支离破碎——而在他们身后，那些触手怪物，{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}，在踱步。它们的心灵指令在你脑海中回荡，如同水撞击岩石。你从喧嚷声中辨认出一层含义——并恐惧地意识到，{@creature orc|MM|orcs}都在低语着："服务！忠诚服务！长久服务！服务！服务！"
{@creature orog|MM|orogs} 高度智慧的 {@creature orc|MM|orcs} 被邪恶的厄利斯德所摧残。北墙上排列着一排长矛，每个 {@creature orog|MM} 脚下都有一个（用于攻击，造成 {@damage 1d10 + 4} 穿刺伤害）可以拾起的长矛。

entries.name: Next Time On...
entries: 这些{@creature orog|MM|orogs}很可能是来自L19号的夺宝者号（Scavenger）的船员。不幸的是，他们的思维已经破碎，只能喃喃地说出"Rukha"，"{@creature Captain N'ghathrod|WDMM}"，和"Scavenger"的名字。

entries.name: Tactics
entries: 经过多次战斗洗礼，{@creature orog|MM|orogs} 使用以下战术，得到{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers} 的支持：

items: {@creature orog|MM|orogs}从通往6B区域的门口开始，距离为5英尺。前面两名战士手持巨斧；他们身后的两名战士手持长矛，使得所有四人都能攻击同一目标。
{@creature orog|MM|orogs}的第三和第四排将{@item javelin|PHB|javelins}投掷到前线防御者倒下的时候；然后他们拔出自己的巨斧，冲向战线。
鉴于他们奴隶的短缺，{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers} 小心翼翼地保护着{@creature orog|MM|orogs}，甚至在混战中穿过队友使用心灵冲击攻击入侵者而不伤及自己。在战斗中穿过盟友算作{@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|3}。
一旦前线防御被突破，{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}加入近战直到生命值减半，然后他们逃往相邻区域，并用{@language Qualith|VGM}锁封住门。

entries.name: 10. Detention Facility

entries: 当你看到监狱时，你就知道了。这个房间里充斥着肮脏和悲伤的牢房，每扇门上都配有那些奇怪的、似乎是邪恶贵族所钟爱的外星人锁。在这里的十个牢房中，只有三个被占用：一个是{@creature troglodyte|MM}，一个是{@creature grimlock|MM}，还有一个是一个人类。
人类立即醒来，挥舞着一枚瓦特德普(C-W)城市警卫徽章。他用一种虚弱但坚定的声音咆哮道："瓦特德普市警卫队！快开这该死的门！"
正如第8区所描述的那样，直到最近还有第四名囚犯，一个名叫兰德斯·斯塔奥（Landers Stao）的人类。他被带去喂给{@creature neothelid|VGM}。

entries.name: Troglodyte
entries: 你可以将{@creature troglodyte|MM|trog}与该派对过去的逃避事件联系起来：也许它属于{@creature troglodyte|MM|troglodytes}(高吉尔)在第10层的团伙，如果不是高吉尔本人的话。如果派对与安德山{@creature troglodyte|MM|trog}(地下山)的任何重要联系，只需将其身份移植到格洛兹(Glorz)身上。

entries.name: Roleplaying Ishan
entries: 伊尚对他的外星监狱守卫一无所知。在他坚毅的外表下，颤抖着对只能用体面死亡来安抚的恐惧。
几分钟前，伊尚的城市守卫搭档，兰德斯·斯塔奥，被厄里斯德{@creature neothelid|VGM}带走了。伊尚并不知道，兰德斯已经被喂给了{@creature neothelid|VGM}。忠心耿耿，伊尚决心在返回沃特德普之前找到兰德斯。他可以追踪到男子在整个建筑物中挣扎的迹象，一直到通往8号区域的门口，尽管那里的{@language Qualith|VGM}锁阻碍了他的前进。

entries.name: "Ahpok"
entries: 在被盗的{@creature grimlock|MM|grimlock's}身体内，一个{@creature intellect devourer|MM}在比喻性地揉着手。它急需新鲜的娱乐，而这个聚会正是一个绝佳的机会。当它用{@language Undercommon|PHB}与他们交谈时，请阅读：
{@creature grimlock|MM}裂开它的龇牙咧嘴微笑。"有一条路！一条逃离这个可恶地方的路！在触手怪来临之前，这些洞穴属于阿泊族，她是唯一的幸存者！阿泊凭借声音、气味、触感熟悉地下山！释放阿泊，阿泊将效劳！阿泊将乐意效劳！阿泊是一位导游，自由而快乐，哦是的！"

entries.name: 11. Halaster is Glowing

entries: 当然，你发现自己面对着你狂野的（Mad Mage）保护者，他本人以大理石雕刻而成。五颜六色的光点在雕像周围飘动，它指着一个拱形门，这是哈拉斯特（Halaster）在地下山脉（Undermountain）上布满的众多奥术之门之一。
这里的门很容易操作，因此你的玩家很可能会将其带到安全地点，从而触发陷阱。如果你真的想捉弄你的玩家，可以让一个冒险队从门中走出，然后以最直观的方式死于{@spell prismatic spray}。

entries.name: 12C. Central Hub
entries: 当冒险小组到达这个区域时，他们可以看到整个动力装置并感知到其超能能量。阅读以下内容：
这个地方有一种风，它不在你耳边呼啸，而是深深地植入你的脑海，你可以在河水的咆哮声中听到它——当你的眼睛落在一个巨大而复杂的机器上时，它的低语变成了尖叫，一个由咆哮的河流驱动的涡轮机。它释放的能量就像夏日的炎热：无处不在且潮湿。你的思绪猛然间一阵晕眩！

entries.name: 12G. Control Room

entries: 在这个阴险的动力中心，坐着一个晶莹的王座——上面坐着一个穿着流苏长袍的六触手的（illithid）（伊利希德） 。王座坐落在一座黑色的外星金属基座上，铜线如蛇般伸入地板，传输着嗡鸣的力量。你的大脑，你的大脑，发麻了。
在邪恶食脑怪后面，伸展着一块水晶屏幕，上面描绘着沃特德普的饥饿之门，这是你非常熟悉的地方。一群吵闹的客人扔掉一张桌子，打碎了他们的玻璃杯，招致了店主{@creature Durnan|WDH}的责骂。
叙述的继续取决于派对首次进入这个房间的方式；如果他们不在模拟中，但是 Extremiton 在的话，"{@creature Durnan|WDH}" 忙着在 Alterdeep 的吵闹顾客中大喊大叫。当 {@creature Durnan|WDH} 大喊时，角色们会注意到邪恶食脑怪的嘴巴在无声地动。

entries.name: 13. Back Door
entries: 如果冒险小组通过这条路线进入思想吞噬者聚集地，而不是从前方闯入，他们在这个层面上的时间会大大缩短。你可以将区域9中的一些{@creature orog|MM|orogs}调整到这个房间中。

entries.name: Inverted Route
entries: 如果队伍在Alterdeep内部开始这一级别，这条路径是逃离邪恶食脑者基地的最快方式。

entries.name: 14. Psipod Nexus I
entries: 以下描述中没有提到通常在这个房间里找到的{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}；它们可以在玩家在场时进入，从另一个房间吵吵嚷嚷地过来。为了避免被发现，队伍可能会溜进psipods——从而使自己容易受到Extremiton及其邪恶游戏的影响。
你本可以一辈子都不看到这种对生命和科学的嘲弄：棺材大小的青铜圆柱托着正在熟睡的男人和女人，他们不安地转动着，仿佛迷失在梦中。每个棺材上都覆盖着一层薄薄的残留物，一种看起来似乎在自行起伏的粘液。
如果队伍开始在奥德迪普（Alterdeep）的级别，或者正在从那里出现，请阅读以下内容：
突然你从梦中惊醒，猛地坐起来，只见自己的额头撞在一个晶莹的盖子上。它在你的皮肤上留下一层难闻的残留物。四周弥漫着这台机器的心灵力量，像弹奏竖琴一样拨动着你的思绪。
从那超现实的经历中眨眨眼，你审视着周围环境：你的棺材是一个圆柱体，铜线从中伸向地板。还有其他人像你一样被困在其他圆柱体中。他们的眼睛也瞥来瞥去，似乎也在与"沃特德普"这个梦境搏斗。
这是什么邪恶的巫术？

entries.name: 15. Psipod Nexus II
entries: 从区域14的描述中借鉴；四名冒险者 {@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers} 可以随后进入这个房间，可能会激怒冒险者，让他们躲进一个心灵荚，从而将他们困在Alterdeep中。

entries.name: 16A. North Guard Post
entries: 这些{@creature duergar|MM}将他们的大脑植入金属蝎子中，这一事实值得充分赞赏。解除他们说话的限制。一旦受到警告，他们用{@language Dwarvish|PHB}大声咒骂和侮辱：

items: "你妈妈只不过是一个 {@creature ogre|MM}，而你爸爸身上散发着接骨木莓的味道，我告诉你！"
"我不知道地表人竟然可以如此薄皮脆肉！"
"我脑袋在罐子里，但我还是能比你更快地追到一个姑娘，你这个家伙，橄榄嘴唇的五月杆！"
(当它造成伤害时) "哦，你现在要哭了吗，是吗？"

entries.name: 16B. South Guard Post
entries: 正如《WDMM》中所描述的，这里的{@creature duergar|MM}已经精神崩溃。他们失去了个人身份感，当参与战斗时，所有八个人同时喊道："为殖民地而战！"
你看到了一件令人不安的事情：两名{@creature mind flayer|MM|mind flayers}紧握着一个晶莹的基座，上面漂浮着一个拳头大小的钻石。他们闭着眼睛，身体承受着他们正在引导的力量。
一座石头构成的摇摇欲坠的桥横跨在咆哮的河流上。只需一瞥，你就能看出它是个致命的陷阱。

entries.name: Epilogue
entries: 穿过Seadeeps后，冒险小组只能展望Undermountain的最后六层。
用以下任一种方式结束本次游戏。两种方式都假设队伍在Alterdeep内部开始了这一级别，并从模拟中走出来——尽管他们进入模拟已经过去多久由你决定。

entries.name: L18
entries: 为了反映Wyillowwood，通往Vanrakdoom的路径已经被重新设计。与其穿过洞穴蜿蜒前往教派的圣所不同，这条路将引领队伍穿过一片死寂的森林。正如在{@i Companion's}下一章中将描述的那样，{@creature cultist|MM|cultists}正在将哈拉斯特创造的地下森林转变为暗影界的一部分。因此，他们的旅程穿越这片死树林。
心灵只是一个游乐场，当你深入挖掘时，它从来不是一个美好的地方。在那超现实的地方，会有什么样的怪物活动呢？有什么样的怪物敢将无辜者连接到一个共享的梦境中？通过制止那个（Illithid）你为水深之城做得很好——谁知道这样的计划会延伸多远，会形成多大的机器，会有多少人被困在它的游乐场中呢？
你做得很好——至少目前是这样。当你凝视着大地的深渊时，你知道还有更糟糕的恐怖物留下了疯狂法师（Mad Mage）。（Mad Mage）.

entries.name: The Host's Send-Off

entries: 当你离开这个超现实的游乐场时，疯狂法师在你耳边大喊道：
"在我们收到一封停止信之前最好你放下(Extremiton)，"疯狂法师告诉你。"它的机器偏离得太危险，接近了没有凡人敢涉足，更不用说诉诸的领域。"
"在这个地方之外，在我山脉的深处，等待着你们的下一个挑战：范拉克厄（Vanrakdoom）。如果你们不是我钟爱的玩物，我会坚持——乞求——你们回头，但唉，对于你们，我的美人儿们，只有一个方向，那就是向下。向下你们走吧，进入我们游戏的最后篇章。"
一听到"Vanrakdoom"，冒险者们的脑海中应该响起警报，因为这样的后缀标志着一个{@creature lich|MM}的巢穴。如果队伍没有意识到这一点，就要求进行一个{@dc 14}智力({@skill Arcana})检定，并告知他们这个事实。
你们是愚蠢的来到这里！放弃你们曾经拥有的爱情！

items: 凡拉克厄暗是一个特别致命的层次。被{@creature vampire|MM}次咬伤，被{@creature shadow|MM|shadows}纠缠，对抗一名{@creature vampire|MM}牧师和一名{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM|shadow dragon}，冒险者们很可能会在这里丧命。{@i Companion}认为，冒险队灭亡或撤退是完全正常的；在后一种情况下，撤退到L19可能是明智的选择，因为这样可以让冒险继续进行，而不是让冒险队直接撞向一堵墙。冒险队可以舔舐伤口，稍后再回来挑战凡拉克厄暗。
{@creature vampire|MM|Vampires}及其后代可以立即使被它们的爪击中的目标瘫痪！需要一个动作通过力量检定({@skill Athletics})来打破这个{@action grapple|PHB}！
在地牢中可以找到{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM|Umbraxakar's}过去的各种小玩意对于拯救他至关重要。它们可以在区域5、8、15和17中找到。

entries.name: Previously on Dungeon of the Mad Mage
entries: 请记住以下事项：

items: 拯救龙任务（见下文详细信息）。
Daggerford（见L2）的美好伙伴中的Midna Tauberth是{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}的一位女祭司。如果她还活着，你可以将她添加到这里，作为{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta's}的{@creature vampire spawn|MM}。

entries.name: Save the Dragon
entries: 这个关卡取决于{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}的历史以及他可能的救赎。唉，如果冒险者们没有时间返回到沃特德普，他们可能永远也收不到"拯救龙"任务。最好让队伍在进入范拉克多姆之前了解一些它的历史，而不是一无所知。因此，{@i Companion}建议一个简单的解决方案：将{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM}，25B区的囚犯，移动到Deadwood——这是由{@i Companion}在巢穴外添加的区域。有关更多详细信息，请参阅"接近范拉克多姆"中的重要区域。

entries.name: The Deadwood
entries: 在哈拉斯特为他最亲爱的伴侣创建{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}之前，疯狂法师首先建造了这片森林。然而，由于疏忽，允许{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}的邪教用暗影界的污染毒害了它。当队伍达到18级时，他们将开始在死木森林中，并受到暗影界影响的影响。

entries.name: Portia Dzuth
entries: 囚犯因{@creature Glyster|WDMM}—龙的旧自我最后的闪现而被释放出地牢。正是因为这个原因，{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}相信{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}可以被拯救。她充当着队伍的任务发布者，告诉他们有关龙和地牢历史的信息，这些信息是她一个月前受雇于瓦特德普的月之星家族时学到的。

在这个变体中，{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia} 尚未被 {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} 所 {@condition charmed}，而是仍然被暗影界的绝望所 {@condition poisoned}。作为后续的转折，你可以让她 {@condition charmed}；在战斗中 {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} 命令她背叛她新结交的盟友。已经 {@condition charmed}，这名战士立即对着队伍发动攻击。
另外，{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}通知了队伍关于邪教对沃特德普的迫在眉睫的袭击。面对这一信息，队伍必须决定他们是立即进攻(%1%邪教)、稍后阻止他们的袭击，还是让他们自生自灭。没有这一重要信息，他们入侵如此致命的圣所的决定就显得毫无意义。

entries.name: The Dragon's Visions
entries: 在这个层次上包含的幻象是讲故事的绝佳方法。与其向你的队伍倾泻一大堆解说词，不如让玩家们用他们的眼睛亲身体验过去。然而，这些幻象很可能是以无序的方式被体验的—这也是乐趣所在，探索的目的又何在，难道不是为了获得传说和战利品的奖励吗？
按时间顺序，这些幻象依次发生：

items: 最好的朋友 (查看区域 4)
在黑暗丛林（见区域5）。将区域5中的戒指添加到当前队伍所在的任何区域，如果按顺序呈现的话。

在符合当地语言习惯的情况下，文本中类似 (%num%) 的内容在翻译中仍应保持为 (%num%)。

黑暗的召唤 (见区域8)。如果有的话，将区域8中的日刃添加到当前队伍所在的区域中，按顺序。
离开这条黑暗的道路吧！(见区域19)
他们应得的（见区域17）
喝醉了（见区域15）
刀锋的救赎（见区域22）

entries: 在A10中，{@creature cultist|MM|cultists}正忙着将另一个{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM|Umbraxakar's}的记忆与暗影界联系起来。如果他们成功了，将会形成另一个幻象，描绘{@creature Glyster|WDMM|Glyster's}悲苦的转变成为{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM|shadow dragon}— 一个他为了亲爱的朋友Vanrak而自愿接受的黑暗变身。按照时间顺序，这个事件会发生在"摆脱这条黑暗之路"和"他们应得的"之间。

entries.name: Areas of Note
entries: 以下区域值得注意：

entries.name: Areas in Summary
entries: 这个非线性层次可能会让人难以跟踪。请参考下表。未列出的区域并不重要，或者在访问前不值得关注。区域19-33位于暗影界(Shadowfell)内。

entries.name: Through the Deadwood
entries: 在这个级别上，{@i Companion} 在Vanrakdoom之前添加了一个死亡的地下森林，这个地下森林是很久以前疯狂法师为Wyllowwood试验而创造的。当{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar's} 邪教将其拉入暗影界时，大多数野兽都逃离了；那些留下的则被腐化了。至于哈拉斯特，他只是耸耸肩，继续观察，对邪教的实验感到好奇。
死木（The Deadwood）发挥了许多功能：

items: 它充当着Seadeeps和Vanrakdoom之间的缓冲。
这给了冒险者们时间舔舐他们的伤口并探索周围。如果他们从范拉克杜姆 (Vanrakdoom) 撤退，他们可以在这里休息。
它暴露了派对{@table Shadowfell Despair|WDMMC}，展示了这个层次的特性和居民。

entries: 该队伍应该在死木林中漫步至少36小时。其骨架般的树木和令人窒息的雾气充斥着延伸数英里的蜿蜒洞穴。就像上面的威洛伍德一样，它被描绘成一片阳光和天空的画布，散发着真实的温暖——或者说，如果暗影界没有将其变成一个阴郁、寒冷的森林，那么它本应如此，其枯枝的树冠遮蔽了阴沉的天空。它被雾气笼罩，容易迷失方向。同样，正如队伍很快会发现的那样，这片死木林并非没有自己的动物群落——而且所有这些动物都受到暗影界的影响，如果不是已经是其本地居民的话。

entries.name: Deadwood Properties
entries: Deadwood（死木）总是受到以下效果的影响：

items: 这片森林是{@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|dimly lit}，树冠稀疏，有些地方黑暗无光。
森林中弥漫着雾气。偶尔，一列厚雾在{@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2|0|heavily obscuring} {@dice 1d4} 30英尺的区域内翻滚着。
无所不在的恐惧就像湿度一样能被感受到。
颜色似乎变得黯淡，甚至有些沉闷。
角色可能会被 {@table Shadowfell Despair|WDMMC} 打败。

entries: 偶尔，这些效应会加剧，就像暗影界的波浪冲击真实物质位面的海岸一样。这种情况会持续{@dice 1d4 × 1d10}分钟，然后逐渐减弱。

entries.name: Random Shadowfell Encounters
entries: 自从在地下山谷的上层地带以来，随机遭遇就没有机会展现过。现在是将它重新加入你的冒险中的时候了，但是这次从只在暗影界中发现的一些更神秘的怪物中汲取灵感。每12小时，掷出一个{@dice d20}。如果掷出18-20，那么队伍将面临一个随机遭遇，根据上面的表确定。
以下是可能的遭遇描述：

entries.name: Dragon Shadow
entries: {@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM} 飞过头顶，他的翅膀在沉闷的寂静中如雷霆般振动。在两轮之内，他飞过队伍的上空，返回瓦拉克多姆(Vanrakdoom)。如果他发现了他们，他会释放他的暗影吐息攻击他们，然后继续前往巢穴。

entries.name: Shadar-kai
entries: 这些干瘪的精灵，神秘{@deity Raven Queen|Dawn War|DMG}的手下，发现自己迷失在地下山。由{@creature gloom weaver|MTF}领导的Rinnrasiel，她和她的{@dice 1d4} {@creature shadow dancer|MTF|shadow dancers} 只是寻求答案，想知道他们身在何处，如何返回至影界。或者，神秘莫测的{@deity Raven Queen|Dawn War|DMG}已经宣称拥有其中一位冒险者的灵魂，于是它们发动攻击。

entries.name: Sorrowsworn
entries: 在影暗界有害本质的显现，这些可怕的存在在{@book Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes|MTF}中有详细描述。

entries.name: Prisoner of Darkness
entries: 在{@i Companion}，{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM}的时候，在25B区的囚犯可以在Deadwood中遇到。在一次仁慈的时刻，{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}将她从Vanrakdoom的地牢中释放出来—因此，她相信这条龙仍然可以被拯救。她可以作为一名向导、任务发布者和队伍的盟友。
当冒险队遇到{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}时，她身着轻便衣服，空手而来，被{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}深深地遗弃在了死木林中。她认为与冒险队相遇是一种天赐良机。阅读：
从灰色的灌木丛中传来一声微弱的哭声，"请...耗尽了，请帮帮我。" 你的目光落在一位女子瘦弱的身影上，她躲藏在一棵骨瘦如柴的树后。她的长袍破烂不堪；荆棘缠绕在布料上。她的双脚泛着红色，沾满泥土，脸上大部分颜色都被抽干了。她瘦弱而憔悴。
"请，庇护所和一把剑，我请求你。他们很快就会来追我；{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} 从不让一个小玩意离开她的手。"

entries.name: Roleplaying Portia
entries: 因失血过多而虚弱的曾经强大的冒险者，如今只剩下一个自己的影子。她从不卷起袖子，以便将{@creature vampire|MM|vampires'}的咬伤隐藏起来，不让旁观者看到。就像在WDMM中一样，她屈服于{@table Shadowfell Despair|WDMMC}，被恐惧所吞噬，表现为以下缺陷："我深信我将在Vanrakdoom死去。"
{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia} 迅速向队伍传达以下信息，并且对此一无所知：

items: 她和她的同伴被Wylynd 月之星女士雇佣，去寻找龙{@creature Glyster|WDMM}—现在{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}—并将他恢复到原来的样子。
{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}, 作为月星之家的老朋友，已经被{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}邪教腐化成了影龙。她相信他心中仍存一丝善念，这在他释放她脱离范拉克厄运时得到了证明。
这一层的Undermountain由(%0%邪教)统治，他们崇拜黑暗与失落女神{@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}。他们正在进行"黑暗仪式"，让地牢充满恐惧和缠绕的阴影。这个邪教由人类和{@creature vampire spawn|MM}组成，由{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM}领导，一个会用吸血鬼力量奖赏她追随者的神职人员。
这个邪教正在策划袭击《水深渊》的神庙，但{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}并不知道是哪些神庙或是何时。
如果给予食物、温暖、休息和一把剑，她将与队伍一起战斗，完成她的任务。

entries.name: Cultists!
entries: 在派对遇见{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}后的一段时间——足够长以休息和恢复健康，但在他们到达范拉克末日之前——{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta}派遣的{@creature cultist|MM|cultists}找到了这个派对。{@creature vampire|MM}对{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}从指间溜走感到愤怒。

他们由{@dice 1d6} {@creature cultist|MM|cultists}，{@dice 1d4} {@creature cult fanatic|MM|cult fanatics} 和一位名叫Hraskal的{@creature vampire spawn|MM} 组成，他是一位前冒险者。Hraskal 战斗至死，但幸存的{@creature cultist|MM|cultists} 很快就会屈服。如果被询问，他们会证实所有{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia's} 的信息，并简要描述地下城的布局，以及解释教派仪式的目的：将龙的记忆锚定在暗影界，并将更多的Vanrakdoom引入那个有害的位面。

entries.name: Shadowfell Despair
entries: 在暗影界弥漫着一种忧郁的氛围。前往这个位面可能会让角色陷入绝望。
当你认为合适时，尽管通常不超过一天一次，你可以要求一个不是原生于暗影界的角色进行一次智力豁免检定{@dc 10}。如果失败，他们会受到绝望的影响。掷出一个骰子{@dice d6}来确定以下结果的影响。
如果一个角色已经受到绝望效果的影响，并且再次未能通过豁免扑克牌，新效果会覆盖旧效果。完成一次长休后，角色可以尝试通过一次 {@dc 15} 感知豁免扑克牌来克服他们的绝望。如果成功，绝望效果就会结束。一个 {@spell calm emotions} 法术可以移除绝望，任何移除诅咒的法术或魔法效果也可以。

entries.name: 1. Entrance
entries: 以下描述假定在你的游戏桌上使用了Deadwood。根据需要进行调整。当冒险者们进入Vanrakdoom时，请阅读以下内容：

在那片荒凉的树林里度过了太久，你来到了由黑色大理石雕刻而成的门前。每扇门外都矗立着一个被雕刻出来的戴兜帽的少女，手握匕首。在左边的门上，有一段铭文凹陷在石头上：「{@style Darkness Quench the Sun;|dnd-font;small-caps}」而在另一扇门上写着：「{@style Darkness Swallow the Moon.|dnd-font;small-caps}」
当你阅读时，石头本身会移动，展示最后一个短语，这次是用象牙刻着的：「{@style We are Nothing but the Night.|dnd-font;small-caps}」
当世界充满沉默和恐惧时，你试图推开门——但你的手却穿过去了，仿佛它们只是由黑色空气构成的。
穿过非实体门的角色可以看到蜿蜒进入Vanrakdoom本体的粗糙隧道。

entries.name: 2. Dusty Emptiness
entries: 在这个房间里，第一次暗影界转移（见《魔物手册》）应该发生，因为房间是空的。如果第一次转移发生在一个有装饰的房间里，冒险者们会误以为是装饰物的责任。
寂静——这里只有寂静，沉重而无处不在，就像紧贴在你腰间的雾气。即使你的脚步踏在石头上，也无法穿透那厚重的幕布。仿佛地牢本身宁愿沉睡或在阴暗中打滚。
越往前走，恐惧在脊椎底部积聚——就像一只能感知即将到来的地震的野兽。当你四处张望时，你感觉到一股无形的波浪掠过你的脚踝——当它退回到那个无形的海洋中时，房间里所有的颜色都褪去，只剩下灰色。
这次转变持续{@dice 1d4}分钟。角色可以进行一次{@dc 18}智力检定，来识别这个现象是来自阴影界的漏洞，即阴影交错。
在薄雾中矗立着一座黑色大理石雕像，雕刻成一位披着斗篷、手持双匕首的女人的样子。在她面前跪着一位身穿黑袍的人，谦卑而沉默。在这个被薄雾笼罩的地方，人物脚下是骷髅的骨骼，几乎无法辨认。
Fog and gloom choke the chamber whose walls were once lined with magnificent tapestries that have since been shredded. Tatters lie heaped in a corner, some depicting coastal scenes.

As you wade through the mist, a vision consumes your mind: your eyes fall upon a windy cliff overlooking the rough seas. A {@creature noble|MM} dressed in adventuring attire turns to you and murmurs, "I cannot mount this expedition without you, {@creature Glyster|WDMM}. The Black Jungles teem with horrors no man can face alone."

The {@creature noble|MM} lays a hand on your shoulder. In his eyes, you see yourself: a regal gentleman whose eyes are the color of freshly worked bronze and whose countenance is creased by frequent smiles. You offer a grin to the nobleman who asks, "We are the best of friends, {@creature Glyster|WDMM}, are we not?"
You, this "{@creature Glyster|WDMM}," nod. "Aye, Vanrak," comes his voice from your throat. "Aye. Until the end of our days, you and I. You and I against the world."
The nobleman shares his own smile. "May {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG} watch over us and this expedition. To Chult we go. Together, as always."
The scene fades away as your mind reels back into the gloom of this place, the contrast of friendship and darkness stark in your very heart.
This chamber is decorated with bas-relief carvings of human skeletons—a macabre furnishing indeed. As you wade through that clinging mist, a vision grips your mind!

Your eyes fall upon a jungle steeped in shadow. At a campfire sit several men and women, their expeditionary gear heaped at their feet. Tents loom like leathern peaks over the barren jungle floor. You face a nobleman whose leather gear is wet with mud and bristling with captured thornbuds. Your hand creeps out from your coat as you hand him a polished coral ring.
"A token," you say. Your voice is solid but strange. "...of our friendship, Vanrak."
The nobleman cradles the ring and slips it on his finger. It glimmers with a rainbow of color. "I will treasure this gift forever," Vanrak says, his smile shining in the firelight.
With that, the vision ends. Your mind is hurled back to the gloom of this wretched place.

entries.name: 7A. Crawling Rats
entries: As the adventurers approach this chamber, they're sure to hear the {@creature cultist|MM|cultists'} chanting and the squealing rats. When they reach the area, read the following:

The scene is lit by violet flames that burn from black wax. Six {@creature cultist|MM|cultists} kneel together, chanting a single phrase: "Darkness quench the sun. Darkness swallow the moon. We are nothing but the night."

Amidst them is a man draped in rats. Dozens crawl across his flesh, roaming across his body as if it were a virgin countryside. His arms are outstretched, T-posed, his brow furrowed as he endures whatever macabre test of devotion this must surely be.
"Darkness..." he grunts over the squeal of rats, "quench the sun. Darkness swallow... the moon."
Shadowfell shifts should happen rapidly here, each lasting a few seconds.
The fog envelopes you and drapes your mind in a misty wreath. You experience a vision!
The world is black with darkness. Neither stars nor moons hang over the sky. Your boots echo out across throne as your voice shouts, "This is madness, Vanrak! Madness!"

A nobleman looms out of the gloom, whirling to face you, his eyes brimming with madness. He levels at you a longsword whose blade is made of pure sunlight. His voice is like shattered glass: "What have we to gear from darkness, you and I, {@creature Glyster|WDMM}? Undermountain is where we belong! It calls to us—can you not hear it?"

Waving his luminous blade about like a lunatic, he continues, "Together we shall see the Moonstar name elevated to glorious heights my father couldn't dream of! Waterdeep will shudder at the very sound of it!"
The last you see is the waving sunlight shed from that sword as the mists sweep in to pull you back to the present.

entries.name: 9. Shadow Vigil

entries: Hardly heard above the legion squeal of rats are cultish chants sang in a low intonation and judicious pronunciation, as if their tongues dare not leave any stone unturned: "Darkness quench the sun. Darkness swallow the moon. Darkness claim this dungeon and all that dwell within."
The dread is thick here, a miasmic mist that kisses at your arms and cheeks, lapping against the shores of your mind as lazily but persistent as the tide.
Multiple Shadowfell shifts should occur here, hinting at the work being done in Area 10.

Unity is a powerful force indeed—for gathered here are both brothers and sisters, all petitioning the cosmos in a single, solid voice: "Darkness quench the sun. Darkness swallow the moon. Darkness claim this dungeon and all that dwell within."

Their ritual is about to bear foul fruit: a cloud of fog roils at the chamber's heart. Black lines arc through the ivory cloud like lightning—and in it dance images of a dragon, bronze and glorious, writhing in pain as cloaked figures darken its scales with foul magic. Its anguished cries echo out from the fog, out across the chamber, all while the {@creature cultist|MM|cultists} pray to the darkness they so desperately crave.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: Any combat here will be short and bloody; against such mighty adventurers, the {@creature cult fanatic|MM|cult fanatics} can only hope to score lucky shots. They employ the following tactics in combat:

items: Once a {@creature cult fanatic|MM} falls, becoming a {@creature shadow assassin|WDMM}, the remaining {@creature cult fanatic|MM|cult fanatics} buff it with spells of {@spell shield of faith} and the like.
The first fanatic to act casts {@spell hold person} on any target they perceive as weak-willed.
The second fanatic casts {@spell spiritual weapon}, preferring to attack a target that succumbed to {@spell hold person}.
The third fanatic casts {@spell command} as a 2nd level spell, demanding that its two targets "flee" or "retreat."
The fourth fanatic casts {@spell inflict wounds} as a 2nd level spell, preferring a target that succumbed to {@spell hold person}.

entries.name: 11. Tunnels and Caverns
entries: For once, the {@i Companion} doesn't suggest contriving a barrier to the next level—for Vanrakdoom is as deadly as it comes. If the party wants to retreat to Level 19, let them.

Should the adventurers flee this place, it won't be they who pay the price but Waterdeep instead—specifically the temples of {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG} and {@deity Lathander|Faerûnian|SCAG|Lathander's} most devout. As described above, the cult's plot must be learned by the party by now, so as to add weight to their decision to thwart the cult now or let them be.
As you gaze across the ruined chamber, a vision slips its way into your brain, rooting itself behind your eyes.

When you blink, the chamber is pristine, glorious. Not yet has that proud throne been reduced to rubble—and slumped within it is a skeletal lord with crimson pinpricks that burn in his empty eye sockets.

"Is this it?" the skeletal lord ponders. "Is this to be my legacy? The legacy of the 'great' Vanrak Moonstar? A shadow king damned to rule these moonless halls, fending off assassins, mad wizards, and ghosts of the ancient dead? Is this all that Lady {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar} has to offer?"
Your voice calls out, "Do not lose yourself, Vanrak—"
The skeletal lord bats at the air, casting away the entire world. "No... I have drunk my fill of darkness and loss, old friend."
With that, the vision slips away from you.

entries.name: 17. Lost Dwarven Horn

entries: Out from the choking mists loom iron hooks set into the walls. Once decorated with portraits, they lie barren, forgotten, red with rust and neglect. Hanging from a hook is a golden war horn encrusted with rubies and sapphires.

As your eyes make out that gilded horn, your mind reels back with a vision of the past. Gone are you from this cramped chamber and instead in a great hall buttressed by six columns. Stone-hewn steps climb to a dais whose far wall is flanked with marble black statues, one carved in the likeness of a cloaked woman wielding a dagger—and the other in the visage of the Mad Mage himself.

The two statues glare at one another as if they were mortal enemies. You look about, noticing that your immense body is scaled and clawed. A hollow voice calls out from the dark, "Give these fools the death they deserve, {@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM}!"

You look out: bound to each column is a blindfolded prisoner, six in all, all weeping, all whimpering before their doom. Sucking in a breath, you unleash a blast of shadow that swallows the nearest prisoner—a dwarf. As his body withers away, a {@creature shadow|MM} rises from his corpse, bowing to the dark. With that bow comes the present, delivering you from the wretched past.

The character that experiences this vision can make a {@dc 17} Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check to identify the cloaked statue as a depiction of {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}. The party may wonder what sort of beef the Mad Mage apparently has with the goddess.

Beyond that shadowed curtain lies a gloomy hall decorated with the bones of the dead and gone. As you step over the threshold, a wave pushes past your body as if you just now dove into a black sea. The world drains away, colorless and forlorn, as dark and foreboding as the depths of the lightless earth.

Make no mistake: you've gone from your world to another, this one empty and wanting. A world without light, without warmth, and certainly without hope. It is hollow—and so too are you, as if your very being has been cheapened by crossing this planar threshold—as if there is a part of you you'll never get back. You know it deep in your bones this merciless truth: things will never be the same again.

entries.name: Dragon's Vision
entries: When a character experiences the vision of the past, read:

The world quivers as a vision swamps over your fragile mind! In it, you're locked in a vicious brawl against a warrior dressed in a {@item mithral chain shirt}. His fist slams against your jaw, but you repay him in kind, flattening him against the tiled floor.
"Vanrak!" you cry, disgusted by this violence and eager to see it resolved. "Cease this madness!"

The warrior stumbles to his feet and reaches for a bladeless hilt. With an arcane word whispered from his lips, a blade of pure sunlight bursts forward. "Remember this, drake? Your gift to me? Challenge me again, and I'll carve out that big heart of yours and eat it!"

Your body twists and enlarges, becoming draconic in nature. Your perspective elevates as you look down at Vanrak, your comrade, your brother. "Vanrak!" you cry again. "I'm your friend! Listen to me—listen! She's using the pain of your father's death to lead you down the darkest of all paths! For the love of {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG}, turn away from {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar}!"
With that impassioned plea, shadows surge in to devour your world and return you to the present.
Figures loom out from the dark, draped in black sheets. As you pull away a sheet, your mind is gripped by a vision that hurls you back to the dark days of the past.

You stand before a knight draped in a {@item mithral chain shirt}, that legendary metal. In his gauntleted hand is the hilt of a bladeless sword. His voice is grave and deepened by sorrow. "This," he tells you, mournfully, "is not the fate either of us deserved. In darkness, we have lost our way."

With an uttered arcane word, sunlight springs forth from the sword's hilt, shedding its golden light across the chamber. The knight, you now see, is a corpse. His face is but bone and his eyes burn with a fire that sheds no light. Likewise, you now see your own form: draconic claws peel at the stone floor; your scales are the color of pregnant shadows.
"I will always love you, my friend," the {@creature death knight|MM} murmurs. "You and I against the world, remember? You and I... I'm sorry, {@creature Glyster|WDMM}."

Before you can act, the {@creature death knight|MM} drives the {@item sun blade|DMG|sunblade} into his own throat, reducing him to dust. The blade snuffs out and clatters to the floor—provoking from your throat an anguished roar that shakes the very foundation of this wretched place and sends your mind back to the present.

entries.name: 25. Prisoner of Darkness
entries: As described in the preamble, {@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM} has been removed from this area to the Deadwood to act as a quest giver for the party. See Through the Deadwood for more details.

entries.name: 26. Vampire Boss

entries: At last you come upon the dark heart of the Cult of {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}: amidst two massive columns lies a wooden table carpeted with maps—and studying them is a pale woman tattooed with a colorless dragon. Behind her looms a furred behemoth, a {@creature abominable yeti|MM|yeti}, imposing and abominable.
The woman gives you a colorless smile. "The Lady of Loss whispered of this day. Welcome, heroes! Welcome to your well-deserved end. All will fall before the Shadow!"
When the adventurers first enter this area, the nine {@creature vampire spawn|MM} laying beneath the fog must make Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to remain hidden.

entries.name: Roleplaying Keresta
entries: As with all other {@creature vampire|MM|vampires}, undeath has scoured away anything good in {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta's} heart. Not even her devotion to {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG} can bring her warmth, although it does fill her with pride—that can only be satisfied at the expense of others. Haughty and imperious, she expects to be obeyed by all; disrespect sends her flying into a rage. Only when mortally wounded does her pride abate long enough for her to flee. Draw on any of the following sample dialogue:

items: "I was like you once, driven by thoughts of fame and fortune—but I have since found a higher calling."
"The Lady of Loss has brought you here to become her greatest champions—my champions."
"The Shadow will consume this world!"
"Hope is a fool's errand."

entries.name: The Yeti in the Room
entries: Look, we don't need to question why {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} has a {@creature yeti|MM} at her disposal—it's Undermountain, after all—but here are some contrived explanations:

items: It is a creature with only the statistics of an {@creature abominable yeti}, perhaps crafted from the flesh of exsanguinated victims or a creature from {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar's} midnight realm.
The {@creature yeti|MM} predates Vanrakdoom; long-lived and humble, it accepted Vanrak as the new master of the dungeon... or saw him as the latest tenant.

The {@creature yeti|MM} hails from an entirely different world; it was to be sold by the crew of the spelljammer spaceship on Level 19. When they crashed into Undermountain, the {@creature yeti|MM} got free and made its way into Vanrakdoom.

entries.name: Doom of a Lengthy Campaign
entries: {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} is haughty indeed, but she's no fool—and so aren't you, the DM. With an {@creature abominable yeti|MM}, nine {@creature vampire spawn|MM}, and possibly a {@creature champion|VGM} ({@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM|Portia}, if she's still {@condition charmed}), this is the deadliest fight the party will have faced in Undermountain. The action economy alone will dwarf even a large party—which probably clocks in at six members at most.

Unless the party uses subterfuge and has a source of sunlight, they're likely to perish here and now. To have Halaster rescue them would be a cop-out, however, so the {@i Companion} offers some suggestions:

items: {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} offers vampirism to the adventurers willing to serve her. They must prove their devotion first by aiding the attack on the temples of {@deity Lathander|Faerûnian|SCAG} and {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG}.
Pit the party on a collision course to face {@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM} first—if they're already armed with the knowledge on how to redeem him. With him on their side, the odds will be evened out.
Reduce the number of {@creature vampire spawn|MM} to four. If the party was accosted by packs of spawn in Area 12, just subtract the {@dice 1d4 + 2} from the nine here.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The party is facing quite the fight; streamline your side of combat with the following tactics.

entries.name: Keresta
entries: On her turns, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} uses the following tactics. She shows no mercy against invaders. "LA" refers to her Legendary Actions.

items: As a {@creature vampire|MM}, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} is a glass cannon lacking ranged attacks. Until she's fully buffed (see below), she sticks to the walls or ceilings, out of reach of melee fighters. Thereafter, she wades into combat as an opportunist. She comes into melee on her turn but exits without provoking opportunity via her Move LA.

Even when wounded, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta}, in her pride, believes she has the upper hand—until her forces dwindle. It's only if the party ostensibly have a source of sunlight that she begins to fear for her life. If so, she retreats at half her hit points, turning into mist to retreat to A31 via A32. She stays there to regenerate hit points until she's ready to fight again. If her minions are defeated in the meantime, she flees, hiding in the most remote places of Vanrakdoom; she can rebuild her cult later.
If wounded and stranded between melee foes, she casts {@spell antilife shell} to hedge them out and avoid their melee weapons (reach weapons can bypass the barrier).

{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} can still dish out damage while using her turns' actions to cast spells. She makes frequent use of her Claw or Bite LA, but always keeps one charge for a Move LA, just in case.
{@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} reserves her 4th level spell slots to deal with foes at range by dropping {@spell blight|PHB|blights} on them.

On her first turn, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} keeps her distance and casts {@spell death ward} on herself. If {@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM} is present and already {@condition charmed}, she orders the {@creature champion|VGM} to betray the adventurers (no action required).

On her second turn, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} casts {@spell spiritual weapon} using a bonus action, sending it into the thick of the party. It takes the form of {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar's} dagger. With her action, she uses her Children of the Night ability to summon {@dice 3d6} {@creature Giant Centipede|MM|giant centipedes}.

On her third turn, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} wades into the melee and casts {@spell spirit guardians} if she's not already {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell. If she is, she casts {@spell destructive wave} instead.

entries.name: Allies
entries: On their turns, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta's} minions follow these tactics:

items: The {@creature yeti|MM} charges forward, wading deep into the party to act as the frontliner. On its first turn, it tries to capture as many foes as possible in its Cold Breath. On its second turn, it uses its Chilling Gaze on a vulnerable target and follows up with its Claw attacks. Remember that it is a size of Huge.

The {@creature Giant Centipede|MM|giant centipedes} surge forward against low-AC foes in an attempt to {@condition Paralyzed|PHB|paralyze} with their Bite attack. Otherwise, they take the {@action Help} action to give advantage to other creatures' attacks.

The {@creature vampire spawn|MM} swarm the adventurers with wild abandon and block their path to {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta}. They make frequent use of their Spider Climb trait to go around the party and harry the flanks, if they don't just climb over the {@creature yeti|MM} itself.

{@creature Portia Dzuth|WDMM} sides with {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM|Keresta} if she's still {@condition charmed}. On her first turn, she squares off with the party's most formidable warrior. She blows through all of her abilities as soon as possible, such as her Second Wind ability.

entries.name: 32. Umbraxakar's Lair
entries: Like Area 26, this encounter is hilariously deadly. Four CR 9 {@creature Shadow Assassin|WDMM|shadow assassins} and eleven {@creature shadow|MM|shadows}, backed up by a {@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM|shadow dragon}? Without sunlight, the party is as good as dead; even with it, few can expect to survive the Strength-draining attacks of the {@creature shadow|MM|shadows}. Consider reducing the number of {@creature shadow|MM|shadows} here if your party lacks these tools.
When the party arrives, launch into the following speech:

You know in your very bones that this was a place no mortal ought to tread. The darkness here is smothering, tyrannical. It clings to your sides, snakes its way into your throat and lays primal dread in your very stomach. You really are nothing more than an up-jumped lizard scared witless by that which lurks in the dark.

And it slithers. In that inky blackness slithers a leviathan, its scales rasping against the stones. The courage in your heart has bled out on the floor and there is only terror left—you try to fight it, to cling to hope and steel, but this dark world has beaten such light out of you.
And it speaks, this darkness. Its voice is midnight hanging over dead woods. It speaks and you listen, the doomed prey lucky enough to hear its own inevitable doom:

"You know as well as I," the leviathan rasps, "that this place will be your grave. I have sensed you since you first stepped foot into my domain. Upon the shoulder of the Shadowfell, I lay in gloom...
"Join me."

{@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM} punctuates those last two words without malice but misery; it is the defeated cry of one who can't ever feel whole, regardless of how many sycophants they manage to surround themselves with—for, in the end, those guests are just as hollow as him.

entries.name: Roleplaying Umbraxakar
entries: No dragon should go without lines, so draw on the following dialogue:

items: "You were fools to come here! To leave the love you once had!"
"Misery is the currency of our realm! May you die rich!"
"If only you had turned back... If only."
"I am the shadow on the moon! I am your end!"

entries.name: The Dragon Redeemed
entries: If the party successfully redeems {@creature Glyster|WDMM}, read:

Moonlight ripples across the dragon's scales as you remind it of the life it once had, the friendship it enjoyed, the memories made and the victories won! You remind him of all that is good and right and worthwhile in the world—a different world than this deleterious plane!

Heaving a sigh of relief, the dragon claws at the stone, as if releasing every toxin left in its body. The darkness slips from his scales, evaporating as shadows that shriek and snarl with disappointment, curling up as smoke. By the gods, it's almost done—almost is {@creature Glyster|WDMM} redeemed! With his every shiver, color surges back into the world, banishing the Shadowfell's dismal taint to the pit whence it came!

The dragon shivers, wretches, vomiting out a blood-streaked curd of solid shadows across the stone floor. You watch with rapt horror as the mass moves on its own accord—a black placenta that slimes its way across the chamber.

"I..." the dragon sighs. "I... feel once again! By the grace of {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG}... I am forgiven—and at last I can forgive myself! It was by no fault of mine that my dearest Vanrak fell to darkness! It was by his own hand that he sought redemption—and so too do I! I am alive! Alive! Begone {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG|Shar}, goddess of loss! Begone shadow-mine! Begone!"

With a mighty roar, {@creature Glyster|WDMM} lances the shadows with a gout of lightning! That mass shrieks and flails as if alive—but in mere moments, all that's left on the floors of Vanrakdoom is a scorch mark. "Come," says the drake, "let us purge this dungeon of the darkness and all who dwell within it!"
If {@creature Umbraxakar|WDMM} is redeemed, eliminate all remaining {@creature shadow|MM|shadows} and {@creature Shadow Assassin|WDMM|shadow assassins} in Vanrakdoom.

entries.name: Epilogue
entries: Vanrakdoom is undoubtedly Undermountain's deadliest level. This very well could be the end of your campaign. Should the adventurers triumph, they should gain enough experience to advance half-way to 16th level.

Unlike previous levels, there is no send-off for Vanrakdoom, only silence by the narrator, be it you or Halaster. Let the gloom of the Shadowfell and its oppressive silence be the send-off to Vanrakdoom, which may have witnessed the retreat, doom, or success of the party.

entries.name: Attacks on Waterdeep
entries: If the party fails to cripple or vanquish the Cult of {@deity Shar|Faerûnian|SCAG}, {@creature Keresta Delvingstone|WDMM} follows through on her plot to assassinate key priests of the temples of {@deity Lathander|Faerûnian|SCAG} and {@deity Selûne|Faerûnian|SCAG} in Waterdeep. If the adventurers return to the surface with this news, the right authorities can prepare themselves. If they don't, they learn of these ghastly terrorist attacks when next they visit Waterdeep.
The cosmos are vast indeed, its secrets and resources ours for the taking...

items: Nothing on this level is serious. The {@i Companion} intends to make it as ridiculous as possible.

Nothing prohibits the party from quickly advancing to the next level of Undermountain; in fact, they're encouraged to do so by the genies on this level. Thus, they should be introduced to both genies their first time on this level, as well as random encounters. You should aim to leave this level by the end of one session.

The genies cannot leave their respective areas even if the party gives its rival the phylactery. However, you can lift this restriction to facilitate vengeful attacks on the party. See Special Events under Areas of Note for details.
{@creature gargoyle|MM|Gargoyles}, present in Area 9, cannot be harmed by non-magical attacks from non-adamantine weapons.

It goes without saying that the genies on this level cannot grant {@spell wish|PHB|wishes} to the party. However, they're certain to imply to the adventurers that they can, in return for a certain {@creature lich|MM|lich's} phylactery...
Area 10 is deceivingly deadly; if a creature falls prey to the culvert, they will drown in ooze as they're swept up in the ooze-river's current.

If your party is lost and aimless on this level, direct Urm, the {@creature mud mephit|MM} in Area 4, to them. It can deliver them to both the genies, who give the party the quest to retrieve {@creature Ezzat|WDMM|Ezzat's} phylactery from Level 20.

entries.name: Previously on Dungeon of the Mad Mage
entries: 请记住以下事项：

items: On L10, the party may have come across altars and statues dedicated to {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF}, the {@creature drow|MM} god of oozes and other slimy creatures.

As described in Halaster's Game supplement, the Mad Mage is fond of announcing this episode's sponsor to the audience. The adventurers may have heard the following Transplanar Advertisement: "This episode of Dungeon of the Mad Mage is brought to you by the {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF} ooze-clerics of Undermountain: fhinala-pekta-een-een-pa-pha! Paaa-pha! The Church of {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF} is not responsible for any caustic burns, mutations, or reduction to jelly matter that will definitely occur during or after baptism."

On L16, the adventurers may have been confronted with proof that there are spacefaring species living out across the cosmos; that there is life among the stars. If they encounter Scavenger, you cement this fact.

The illithids of L17 have a host of {@creature orog|MM|orogs} under their control; while it's never confirmed in WDMM, it's likely they were all survivors of the Scavenger's crash and {@creature Captain N'ghathrod|WDMM|Captain N'ghathrod's} starved betrayal.

entries.name: Halaster's Game
entries: As an immortal magus of great power, Halaster has found himself acting as other higher beings do. Sure, he could take the fight to the {@creature lich|MM} {@creature Ezzat|WDMM} himself, but such a task is beneath him. Like deities and feylords, Halaster has a game of cat-and-mouse to play. That's where the adventurers come in—and, if you play Halaster as the archetypal game show host of Dungeon of the Mad Mage, he knows it'll make great TV.

Level 19 excels as a short chapter sandwiched between two dangerous levels of Undermountain. After Vanrakdoom, the adventurers (and players) will need a breather. The party can run through this level passively, perhaps only facing the oozes and {@creature orog|MM|orogs} scattered across the caverns.

entries.name: The Chessmaster
entries: The Mad Mage, for his part, is surprisingly silent on this level. He relies on Urm, the {@creature mud mephit|MM} in Area 4, to push his pawns to Level 20. He should, for once, keep his distance from the party as they entertain offers from the genies.

entries.name: A Rock & a Hard Place
entries: The party must pick their poison if they agree to the genies' terms. Of the two, Ichthyglug the {@creature marid|MM} is surely the gentler patron to spurn, for it lacks the minions that its rival has. In contrast, Jarûk is sadistic and cruel. It's backed up by minions that can go where it cannot.

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: The Caverns of Ooze are already absurd, but it's time to dial that up to eleven. Since the genies already sing, we might as well play some... copyrighted songs throughout the level. Adjust the campaign to better fit a song, such as changing the name of the {@creature orog|MM} Rukha (see A2) to Gaston for the sake of the song. Otherwise, simply ignore any discrepancies the music may offer.
Several songs are suggested throughout the level with this variant, which can be found online. Play them at the terrible risk of summoning the ghost of Walt Disney.

entries.name: Knot in the Weave
entries: Spacefaring individuals (such as the pirates from The Scavenger) are especially vulnerable to the Knot in the Weave, the very force that drove Halaster insane. Continued exposure has planted seeds of madness in the crew, who now sing just as the genies on this floor do. Or that's how you can rationalize it, anyway.

entries.name: Areas of Note
entries: 以下区域值得注意：

entries.name: "Random" Encounters
entries: The Caverns of Ooze are large but empty. The party should face the encounters outlined in WDMM, but with added narrative.

entries.name: Huge Gray Ooze
entries: The ooze is best encountered in the tunnel to Level 18. It slides in from A13. Halaster telepathically announces, "This episode of Dungeon of the Mad Mage is brought to you by the {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF} ooze-clerics of Undermountain: fhinala-pekta-een-een-pa-pha! Paaa-pha! The Church of {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF} is not responsible for any caustic burns, mutations, or reduction to jelly matter that will definitely occur during or after baptism."

The ooze has swallowed {@dice 1d4 + 4} willing {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF} {@creature cultist|MM|cultists}, who are slowly being dissolved. These masochists, however, consider it a trial imposed by their deity. While in the ooze, they are considered {@condition restrained}. Likewise, they're unarmed and unable to attack. They're simply along for the ride and shout insane gibberings held dear by the Church of {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF}:

items: "Pekta-een... Pekta-eeeeen!"
"Come on in; the water's pekta-een."
"It's all pekta-een in here, my man."
"Life has many doors, Ed-boy!"
"Surf's always up with {@deity Ghaunadaur|Drow|MTF}."
"Join us! Free baklenal on Tuesdays!"

"I am one with the ooze; the ooze is with me. One with the ooze, the ooze is with me." (When one {@creature cultist|MM} says this, the nearest {@creature cultist|MM} immediately adds, "He is one with the ooze; the ooze is with us. He is one with me; the ooze is with us."

entries.name: Intelligent Black Puddings
entries: Make the most of the {@creature black pudding|MM|puddings}, who can harangue the party throughout the caverns. They should attack at least twice, preferably as the adventurers leave a genie's territory and while near The Scavenger.

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: If the {@creature black pudding|MM|black puddings} hope to return to their true forms, the song Human Again from Beauty and the Beast would be perfect. At your table, you may see fit to make that change to invoke this variant. Otherwise, the songs Circle of Life or Hakuna Matata from Lion King serve to express the oozes' jubilance. Per this variant, they can still speak, despite being turned into oozelings.

entries.name: Space Orogs
entries: The space {@creature orog|MM|orogs} are best encountered along the banks of the ooze river, such as in Area 3B, 4, and 5A. They must take care to avoid provoking the genies' wrath and thus won't pursue prey into those territories.

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: Driven insane by hunger and the Knot in the Weave, the {@creature orog|MM|orogs} sing as they fight. In particular, they sing Can You Feel the Love Tonight from Lion King.

entries.name: 1. The Resplendent Grotto...
entries: As the adventurers descend into L19, they should encounter the {@creature huge gray ooze|WDMM} described in "Random" Encounters above.

entries.name: 1C. Ichthyglug's Cavern

entries: The air is warm, humid. It clings to your flesh as the scent of the sea overwhelms your senses. Melodic music brings you back to better days, days on the beach and in the surf.
As you round the bend and approach the cavern's heart, an enchanting voice booms, "Welcome to my grotto!"

That's when you see it swimming in a pool of shimmering water: a piscine creature dressed in flowing robes whose cuffs are embroidered with illustrious pearls. You know what you're looking at; the legends have never failed you before. It's a genie, a genie here and in the flesh.
Continue with Ichthyglug's song once you finish with the text above.

entries.name: Music
entries: By ignoring WDMM's specification that the music playing is harp music, you can use any of the following songs at your table:

items: The opening to Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
Two Steps from Hell's Colin Frake
Two Steps From Hell's Legend of Velkee
Two Steps From Hell's Nightwood (seriously, the entire album is amazing).

entries.name: Roleplaying Ichthyglug
entries: The {@creature marid|MM} is as covetous as the rest of its kin; it's truly a shame that these new, marvelous baubles (the party) must be sent away to retrieve {@creature Ezzat|WDMM|Ezzat's} phylactery, as Ichthyglug would like nothing more than to keep them around as trophies and trinkets. Still, the {@creature marid|MM} is kind and full of mirth, and fond of tranquil music. Whether the party agrees to fetch {@creature Ezzat|WDMM|Ezzat's} phylactery, Ichthyglug allows them to rest in its cavern, offering the "freshest of refreshments" (which is water drawn from its native plane). Ichthyglug can also be fleshed out with the following sample dialogue:

items: "You must take care, for the {@creature lich|MM} {@creature Ezzat|WDMM} is a master of magic. A handful of heroes like yourself have fallen prey to his dark spells and I have wept each and every time. Should you fall... I will weep for you as well."

"No doubt the mephit will lead you to Jarûk, that ground-hugging {@creature dao|MM}, if its minions do not deliver you first to its sandy doorstep. Tread carefully, for the {@creature dao|MM} are greed-manifest. Trust not its offers, for a usurer never lends money it has no intention of reaping interest on."

"...afterwards, you may join me in my coral palace in the depths of the Plane of Water. Together we can enjoy such lavish luxuries like olives, perfume, flayed eels, music, and the like. You can check out at any time, though you can't ever leave..."

"The ooze that so superfluously fills these caverns comes from the Swamp of Oblivion: the border between the pristine Plane of Water and that muddy realm that is the Plane of Earth. It is a dismal place, an affront to the very senses! I mean, can you imagine it! Purest water tainted by soil and earth and conceit!"

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: If using this variant, play the song Hawaiian Rollercoaster Ride from the film Lilo & Stitch and use it to voice Ichthyglug's desire to return home. Under the Sea from The Little Mermaid is also a fitting song to describe the Plane of Water's mystical beauty.

entries.name: Ichthyglug's Quest
entries: When the genie propositions the adventurers to retrieve {@creature Ezzat|WDMM|Ezzat's} phylactery, he of course does it in song. Read the following, while keeping in mind that the author of the {@i Companion} is as tone-deaf as they come.
I've been pressed into service!
Can't you help me so?
Below here lairs a {@creature lich|MM},
Did ya happen to know?
See the Mad Mage... he's got a grudge!
That {@creature lich|MM} has got to go!
{@creature Ezzat|WDMM|Ezzat's} his name, a real mean fella!
Oh, can't you help me so?
Venture there for me!
Return with his phylactery!
I'll reward you, I swear!
Loot beyond satisfactory!
So, what say you, pal?
You reap what you sow,
Riches can be yours!
Oh, won't you help me so?

entries.name: 2. Space Orogs
entries: Unlike WDMM, the space {@creature orog|MM|orogs} should be hostile but hesitant to attack the party. Rukha has more to gain by treating with the outsiders at first, namely in the form of {@item Rations (1 day)|PHB|rations}. Meanwhile, her men circle around the party to attack if they prove less than generous.

entries.name: Roleplaying Rukha
entries: Rukha speaks {@language Common|PHB}—or rather, a strange dialect of it spoken by spacefarers. Her companions follow suit. When she first interacts with the party, it never even occurs to Rukha that they might not know of space travel and it would shock her to learn otherwise. Calm, civil, and level-headed, she may surprise adventurers with an unkind opinion of the average {@creature orc|MM}. You can draw upon any of the following sample dialogue to help shape the story she feeds the party:

items: "We were laying low in the planet's orbit, far outside the eyes of Johnny Law, when a portal opened up before the ship. Our captain saw it as a boon—and fearing that the constables were on our tail, we took it. All readings suggested we'd end up on the edge of the solar system. Instead, we crashed in this dismal cavern."

"Much of our crew hails from Wheeled H'catha, farthest orb from the sun. Nothing on this earth or the next will convince me to go back; I'd rather die a brigand than live under a {@creature beholder|MM|beholder's} lash."

"Captain's an illithid. One of the good ones, I suppose. Or was, before he started to starve. When he ran out of pickled brains, he turned on us. Look, I know a rabid dog can't help but bite, but I don't have to just give it an arm. We high-tailed it outta there."

"Without the spelljamming helm, our craft's dead in the water. When we crashed, some old-timer flashed into the Bridge, snatched it, and disappeared as fast as he came in. Saw it m'self, an' I'll remember his fearsome battle cry 'til the end of my days: 'Yoink!'"

"You don't know what a spelljamming helm is? What are you, straight primitive? The helm is a high-backed ornate chair attuned to the very stars. A magus sat upon it can traverse a million miles in a matter of hours."

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: With this variant, the song Gaston from Beauty and the Beast should be played as the adventurers overhear a conversation between the {@creature orog|MM|orogs} in which they praise Rukha (or "Gaston" if you see fit to change her name) prior to their arrival.

entries.name: 3A. The Great Ooze March

entries: The ooze meanders in a lazy river throughout these stinking caverns. As you tread upon its banks, the surface ripples! You instinctively ready for another peculiar confrontation—but the ooze has other plans. It coalesces into a conga line of strange, geometric beings: modrons.

These modrons, however, are not native to that distant plane of Mechanus. Forged from ooze, they clasp their hands upon each other's sharp-angled shoulders in brotherly love. They march onward, making little progress against the ooze-river's current, but still they sing in camaraderie:

"The modrons go marching one by one, huzzah, huzzah. The modrons go marching one by one, huzzah! Huzzah! The modrons go marching one by one! The little one stops to share a pun, and they all go marching on!

"The modrons go marching two by two, huzzah, huzzah. The modrons go marching two by two, huzzah! Huzzah! The modrons go marching two by two! The simple ones stops to tune its axiomatic-mind lest it defy its basic programming—and they all go marching on!"
If left unchecked, this song reaches thirty-six before the ooze-modrons collapse back into goo.

entries.name: 4. The Weeping Eye

entries: The ooze-river's tide is strongest here, and you can see why: the river begins not from deep underground, but from a floating orb of murky slime that weeps ooze into the cavern. It floats above the tide, two armlengths in diameter.
When the adventurers reach the "M" on the map, read:

You sweep your gaze across the fetid river, catching sight of ripples that originate from the bank. You squint, making out the shape of an imp made of mud. It's absentmindedly poking the surface of the ooze with a stick.

Urm is bored to tears; if it wasn't already compelled by a {@spell geas} spell to see Halaster's quest fulfilled, it'd approach the party itself, flying above the river if not diving into its foul depths.

entries.name: Roleplaying Urm
entries: Urm belongs on a farm—which is what the Swamp of Oblivion is most like among the Inner Planes. It starts just about every sentence with "boy" or "lemme tell ya." It's an ungrateful being, prone to blaming others for its woes. You can draw on any of the sample dialogue to share its tale:

items: "Boy, lemme tell ya a tale. There I was, minding my own business in the Swamp-'Blivion, when a sorta flood swept me out and into the Material Plane. Suddenly, I'm pressed into service by some old man by his gods-damned {@spell geas} spell, forced t'be messenger and punchin' bag to two genies, both of 'em held up to some bargain with the same magus that bound me. Neither can hold a tune. I'm Urm, by the way."
"Per my geas, I'm to act as messenger 'tween the genies bound here. Mostly I'm sent to spirit along insults."

"The {@creature dao|MM} roosts in that direction. Name's Jarûk. Lives in a sandpit, tended to by living boulders and {@creature gargoyle|MM|gargoyles}. Cruel as the rest of its kin, no matter how civil a smile it wears."
"Ichthyglug 'the Volum-nous' as it calls itself, is a {@creature marid|MM} lairin' in the grotto thatta-way. Loves flattery more than anythin' else, but don't you dare enter its pool."

"Neither Jarûk or Ichthyglug can leave their d'mains. They're bound there by the same magic of the magus as I am. 'Til they get some {@creature lich|MM|lich's} phy-lak-to-ree, they cain't return to the Elemental Planes. Way I see it, they's desperate."

entries: As you trudge through ankle-deep ooze in another otherwise nondescript cavern, you spot a gargantuan cuttlefish through a gap in the wall.

You're so distracted by this oddity that you trip and fall into the muck. But when you clear the ooze from your eyes, that fish is still there—an utterly massive cuttlefish stranded in Undermountain. As you peer through the gloom, agog and confused, you make out finer details: the oddity is actually an entire vessel carved to resemble a cuttlefish. Its eyes are portholes and iron rivets line its sides. There are no sails, no oars, but you're certain it's a ship of some kind—which begs the question: what sort of moron models a vessel after a cuttlefish?
Floating before two crystalline menhirs is a {@creature beholder|MM}, silent and brooding and patient. The air is thick with strange spores that meander about in the sour air.

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: Honestly, at this point, even the demons ought to be singing. As they look like a mockery of apes and boars, they sing I Wanna Be Like You from The Jungle Book. Those that listen to the entire song and compliment the demons' singing are rewarded with the command word needed to open the arcane gate. Otherwise, they attack.

entries.name: 8. Thanks for the Memories
entries: While the adventurers are in this area, they should experience every memory the gas spores can offer. These memories are described in Area 7. If you don't want to inundate your party with them now, just have them harmlessly inhale spores throughout the level without the danger of facing an actual {@creature gas spore|MM}.

entries.name: 9. High Ground
entries: When the adventurers encounter the {@creature gargoyle|MM|gargoyles}, read:

Out from the dark comes the thunderous beating of wings on stale air and the scratch of stone on stone. They emerge from the gloom as a single flock: {@creature gargoyle|MM|gargoyles} brandishing outlandish grins on their stony faces.
Their leader lands before you and renders to you a deep bow. The {@creature gargoyle|MM} babbles in a language that sounds like stones getting it on. It bears an air of hospitality.
While this spectacle unfolds, you spot a sixth {@creature gargoyle|MM} flying away, towards the cavern's rear, but whether it's as a messenger or tattletale, you do not know.
The {@creature gargoyle|MM|gargoyles}, proud but amicable servants of Jarûk, treat the party as honored guests.

entries.name: Gargoylic Insult
entries: If the {@creature gargoyle|MM|gargoyles} deign the party as fools, one hurls an insult in {@language Terran|PHB}: "Your mother was a mephit and your father reeked of fireberries!"

entries.name: 10. Culvert
entries: As with all deadly traps, this one ought to be made apparent.

entries.name: Maximum Absurdity
entries: If a character falls prey to the culvert, the ooze itself sings A Whole New World from Aladdin as they're scraped against dagger-like stones and drowned.

This cavern is wall-papered in violet crystals that gleam with a rainbow of light, blazing brighter than the fiercest stars of the night sky—and without any darkness to diminish their light. It's as if you've walked into the stomach of a geode. At its heart is a pit of sand.

Music is everywhere, reverberating off of every stone and rock of this place, rolling through the cavern like an invisible force. As you listen, mesmerized by the drums, the sands stir. A voice booms, "Welcome to my cavern!"

Out from the sand pit looms a creature whose flesh is stone. Its features are humanoid, but its eyes are twin topazes that gleam with the fury of the sun. Dressed in a robe of soft-worked golden-scales, you recognize the creature from legend: a genie of the Plane of Earth... a {@creature dao|MM} in the "flesh."

entries.name: Roleplaying Jarûk
entries: Jarûk keeps to an imperious tone, as it's used to being obeyed. All {@creature dao|MM} are cruel by their very nature and Jarûk is no exception. It will only ever see "lesser" creatures as pawns to its own ambitions; the adventurers are just the latest stock of pieces to be moved across its chessboard. You can flesh out the {@creature dao|MM} with any of this sample dialogue:

items: "When I am freed, I will return to the Plane of Earth. To my call will my vassals flock, their levies raised and armed. And I will return here to teach that impetuous mage the price of arrogance. He will taste the fury of the Earth—and when his broken body is lain at my feet, I will lean down to whisper the slur he first addressed me with long ago when I was ripped away from my palace: "Howdy."

"{@creature Ezzat|WDMM} is a cunning foe, indeed. In undeath, he has found the strength and safety of the earth, burying himself in a stalagmite tower decorated in runes. These runes... they sing. I hear the song as I ponder the mysteries. The 'Runestone,' as the mage calls it, is a tremendous font of power. I often wonder from which dao-lord it was stolen from, for it is impossible for a mere mortal to create such an impressive crystal."

"These caverns are filled with the blood and strength of the Plane of Earth. I speak, of course, of the ooze that clogs the subterranean arteries of Undermountain.
